items.name: Acid
items.description: When you take the action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a vial of Acid. Target one creature or object you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw ( plus your Dexterity modifier and ) or take Acid damage.

items.name: Alchemist's Fire
items.description: When you take the action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Alchemist's Fire. Target one creature or object you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw ( plus your Dexterity modifier and ) or take Fire damage and start .

items.name: Amulet
items.description: For an Amulet to be an effective Holy Symbol, it must be worn or held.

items.name: Antitoxin
items.description: As a , you can drink a vial of Antitoxin to gain on saving throws to avoid or end the condition for 1 hour.

items.name: Arrow
items.description: Arrows are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Arrows are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Arrows (20)
items.description: Arrows are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Arrows are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Assassin's Blood
items.description: A creature subjected to Assassin's Blood makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 6 () Poison damage and has the condition for 24 hours. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

items.name: Backpack
items.description: A Backpack holds up to 30 pounds within 1 cubic foot. It can also serve as a saddlebag.

items.name: Ball Bearings
items.description: As a action, you can spill Ball Bearings from their pouch. They spread to cover a level, 10-foot-square area within 10 feet of yourself. A creature that enters this area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the condition. It takes 10 minutes to recover the Ball Bearings.

items.name: Barrel
items.description: A Barrel holds up to 40 gallons of liquid or up to 4 cubic feet of dry goods.

items.name: Basic Poison
items.description: As a , you can use a vial of Basic Poison to coat one weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. A creature that takes Piercing or Slashing damage from the poisoned weapon or ammunition takes an extra Poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute or until its damage is dealt, whichever comes first.

items.name: Basket
items.description: A Basket holds up to 40 pounds within 2 cubic feet.

items.name: Bedroll
items.description: A Bedroll sleeps one Small or Medium creature. While in a Bedroll, you automatically succeed on saving throws against (see the ).

items.name: Bell
items.description: When rung as a action, a Bell produces a sound that can be heard up to 60 feet away.

items.name: Blanket
items.description: While wrapped in a blanket, you have on saving throws against (see the ).

items.name: Block and Tackle
items.description: A allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

items.name: Bolt
items.description: Crossbow bolts are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Bolts are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Bolts (20)
items.description: Crossbow bolts are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Bolts are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Book
items.description: A Book contains fiction or nonfiction. If you consult an accurate nonfiction Book about its topic, you gain a +5 bonus to Intelligence (, , , or ) checks you make about that topic.

items.name: Bucket
items.description: A Bucket holds up to half a cubic foot of contents.

items.name: Bullseye Lantern
items.description: A Bullseye Lantern burns Oil as fuel to cast in a 60-foot Cone and for an additional 60 feet.

items.name: Burglar's Pack
items.description: A Burglar's Pack contains the following items: , , , 10 , , , 7 flasks of , 5 days of , , , and .

items.name: Burnt Othur Fumes
items.description: A creature subjected to Burnt Othur Fumes must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 10 () Poison damage, and it must repeat the save at the start of each of its turns. On each successive failed save, the creature takes 3 () Poison damage. After three successful saves, the poison ends.

items.name: Caltrops
items.description: As a action, you can spread Caltrops from their bag to cover a 5-foot-square area within 5 feet of yourself. A creature that enters this area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1 Piercing damage and have its reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. It takes 10 minutes to recover the Caltrops.

items.name: Candle
items.description: For 1 hour, a lit Candle sheds in a 5-foot radius and for an additional 5 feet.

items.name: Carrion Crawler Mucus
items.description: A creature subjected to Carrion Crawler Mucus must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition for 1 minute. The creature also has the condition while in this way. The creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Chain
items.description: As a action, you can wrap a Chain around an unwilling creature within 5 feet of yourself that has the , , or condition if you succeed on a Strength () check. If the creature's legs are bound, the creature has the condition until it escapes. Escaping the Chain requires the creature to make a successful Dexterity () check as an action. Bursting the Chain requires a successful Strength () check as an action.

items.name: Chest
items.description: A Chest holds up to 12 cubic feet of contents.

items.name: Climber's Kit
items.description: A Climber's Kit includes boot tips, gloves, pitons, and a harness. As a action, you can use the Climber's Kit to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the anchor point, and you can't move more than 25 feet from there without undoing the anchor as a .

items.name: Component Pouch
items.description: A Component Pouch is watertight and filled with compartments that hold all the free Material components of your spells.

items.name: Costume
items.description: While wearing a Costume, you have on any ability check you make to impersonate the person or type of person it represents.

items.name: Crossbow Bolt Case
items.description: A holds up to 20 Bolts.

items.name: Crowbar
items.description: Using a Crowbar gives you on Strength checks where the Crowbar's leverage can be applied.

items.name: Diplomat's Pack
items.description: A Diplomat's Pack contains the following items: , , , 5 , , 2 , 4 flasks of , 5 sheets of , 5 sheets of , , and .

items.name: Dungeoneer's Pack
items.description: A Dungeoneer's Pack contains the following items: , , , 2 flasks of , 10 days of , , , 10 , and .

items.name: Emblem
items.description: For an Emblem to be an effective Holy Symbol, it must be borne on fabric (such as a tabard or banner) or a .

items.name: Entertainer's Pack
items.description: An Entertainer's Pack contains the following items: , , , , 3 , , 8 flasks of , 9 days of , , and .

items.name: Essence of Ether
items.description: A creature subjected to Essence of Ether must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition for 8 hours. The creature also has the condition while in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

items.name: Exotic Saddle
items.description: A saddle comes with a bit, a bridle, reins, and any other equipment needed to use the saddle. An Exotic Saddle is required for riding an aquatic or a flying mount.

items.name: Explorer's Pack
items.description: An Explorer's Pack contains the following items: , , 2 flasks of , 10 days of , , , 10 , and .

items.name: Fine Clothes
items.description: Fine Clothes are made of expensive fabrics and adorned with expertly crafted details. Some events and locations admit only people wearing these clothes.

items.name: Flask
items.description: A Flask holds up to 1 pint.

items.name: Glass Bottle
items.description: A Glass Bottle holds up to 1Â½ pints.

items.name: Grappling Hook
items.description: As a action, you can throw the Grappling Hook at a railing, a ledge, or another catch within 50 feet of yourself, and the hook catches on if you succeed on a Dexterity () check. If you tied a Rope to the hook, you can then climb it.

items.name: Healer's Kit
items.description: A Healer's Kit has ten uses. As a action, you can expend one of its uses to stabilize an creature that has 0 without needing to make a Wisdom () check.

items.name: Holy Water
items.description: When you take the action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Holy Water. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw ( plus your Dexterity modifier and ) or take Radiant damage if it is a Fiend or an Undead.

items.name: Hooded Lantern
items.description: A Hooded Lantern burns Oil as fuel to cast in a 30-foot radius and for an additional 30 feet. As a , you can lower the hood, reducing the light to in a 5-foot radius, or raise it again.

items.name: Hunting Trap
items.description: As a action, you can set a Hunting Trap, which is a sawtooth steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take Piercing damage and have its reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet). A creature can use its action to make a Strength () check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 Piercing damage to the trapped creature.

items.name: Ink
items.description: Ink comes in a 1-ounce bottle, which provides enough ink to write about 500 pages.

items.name: Ink Pen
items.description: Using , an Ink Pen is used to write or draw.

items.name: Iron Pot
items.description: An Iron Pot holds up to 1 gallon.

items.name: Iron Spike
items.description: Iron Spikes come in bundles of ten. As a action, you can use a blunt object, such as a , to hammer a spike into wood, earth, or a similar material. You can do so to jam a door shut or to then tie a or to the Spike.

items.name: Iron Spikes
items.description: Iron Spikes come in bundles of ten. As a action, you can use a blunt object, such as a , to hammer a spike into wood, earth, or a similar material. You can do so to jam a door shut or to then tie a or to the Spike.

items.name: Jug
items.description: A Jug holds up to 1 gallon.

items.name: Ladder
items.description: A Ladder is 10 feet tall. You must climb to move up or down it.

items.name: Lamp
items.description: A Lamp burns as fuel to cast in a 15-foot radius and for an additional 30 feet.

items.name: Lance
items.description: A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

items.name: Lock
items.description: A Lock comes with a key. Without the key, a creature can use to pick this Lock with a successful Dexterity () check.

items.name: Lolth's Sting
items.description: A creature subjected to Lolth's Sting must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition for 1 hour. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, the creature also has the condition while in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

items.name: Magnifying Glass
items.description: A Magnifying Glass grants on any ability check made to appraise or inspect a highly detailed item. Lighting a fire with a Magnifying Glass requires light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite.

items.name: Malice
items.description: A creature subjected to Malice must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition for 1 hour. The creature also has the condition while in this way.

items.name: Manacles
items.description: As a action, you can use Manacles to bind an unwilling Small or Medium creature within 5 feet of yourself that has the , , or condition if you succeed on a Dexterity () check. While bound, a creature has on attack rolls, and the creature is if the Manacles are attached to a chain or hook that is fixed in place. Escaping the Manacles requires a successful Dexterity () check as an action. Bursting them requires a successful Strength () check as an action. Each set of Manacles comes with a key. Without the key, a creature can use to pick the Manacles' lock with a successful Dexterity () check.

items.name: Map or Scroll Case
items.description: A holds up to 10 sheets of paper or 5 sheets of parchment.

items.name: Midnight Tears
items.description: A creature that ingests Midnight Tears suffers no effect until the stroke of midnight. Any effect that ends the condition neutralizes this poison. If the poison hasn't been neutralized before midnight, the creature makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 31 () Poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Military Saddle
items.description: A saddle comes with a bit, a bridle, reins, and any other equipment needed to use the saddle. A Military Saddle gives on any ability check you make to remain mounted.

items.name: Mirror
items.description: A handheld steel Mirror is useful for personal cosmetics but also for peeking around corners and reflecting light as a signal.

items.name: Needle
items.description: Blowgun needles are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Needles are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Needles (50)
items.description: Blowgun needles are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Needles are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Net
items.description: When you take the action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a Net. Target a creature you can see within 15 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw ( plus your Dexterity modifier and ) or have the condition until it escapes. The target succeeds automatically if it is Huge or larger. To escape, the target or a creature within 5 feet of it must take an action to make a Strength () check, freeing the creature on a success. Destroying the Net (AC 10; 5 HP; to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage) also frees the target, ending the effect.

items.name: Oil
items.description: You can douse a creature, object, or space with Oil or use it as fuel, as detailed below. **Dousing a Creature or an Object**:  When you take the action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing an Oil flask. Target one creature or object within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw ( plus your Dexterity modifier and ) or be covered in oil. If the target takes Fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an extra 5 Fire damage from burning oil. **Dousing a Space**:  You can take the action to pour an Oil flask on level ground to cover a 5-foot-square area within 5 feet of yourself. If lit, the oil burns until the end of the turn 2 rounds from when the oil was lit (or 12 seconds) and deals 5 Fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn there. A creature can take this damage only once per turn. **Fuel**:  Oil serves as fuel for Lamps and Lanterns. Once lit, a flask of Oil burns for 6 hours in a Lamp or Lantern. That duration doesn't need to be consecutive; you can extinguish the burning Oil (as a action) and rekindle it again until it has burned for a total of 6 hours.

items.name: Oil of Taggit
items.description: A creature subjected to Oil of Taggit must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition for 24 hours. The creature also has the condition while in this way. It wakes up if it takes damage.

items.name: Pale Tincture
items.description: A creature subjected to Pale Tincture must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 3 () Poison damage and have the condition. The creature repeats the save every 24 hours, taking 3 () Poison damage on a failed save. The damage the poison deals can't be healed by any means while the creature remains . After seven successful saves against the poison, the creature is no longer .

items.name: Paper
items.description: One sheet of Paper can hold about 250 handwritten words.

items.name: Parchment
items.description: One sheet of Parchment can hold about 250 handwritten words.

items.name: Perfume
items.description: Perfume comes in a 4-ounce vial. For 1 hour after applying Perfume to yourself, you have on Charisma () checks made to influence an Indifferent Humanoid within 5 feet of yourself.

items.name: Pole
items.description: A Pole is 10 feet long. You can use it to touch something up to 10 feet away. If you must make a Strength () check as part of a High or , you can use the Pole to vault, giving yourself on the check.

items.name: Portable Ram
items.description: You can use a Portable Ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus to the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you on this check.

items.name: Pouch
items.description: A Pouch holds up to 6 pounds within one-fifth of a cubic foot.

items.name: Priest's Pack
items.description: A Priest's Pack contains the following items: , , , , 7 days of , , and .

items.name: Purple Worm Poison
items.description: A creature subjected to Purple Worm Poison makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 35 () Poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Quiver
items.description: A Quiver holds up to 20 Arrows.

items.name: Rations
items.description: Rations consist of travel-ready food, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts. See "" for the risks of not eating.

items.name: Reliquary
items.description: For a Reliquary to be an effective Holy Symbol, it must be held.

items.name: Riding Saddle
items.description: A saddle comes with a bit, a bridle, reins, and any other equipment needed to use the saddle.

items.name: Robe
items.description: A Robe has vocational or ceremonial significance. Some events and locations admit only people wearing a Robe bearing certain colors or symbols.

items.name: Rope
items.description: As a action, you can tie a knot with Rope if you succeed on a Dexterity () check. The Rope can be burst with a successful Strength () check. You can bind an unwilling creature with the Rope only if the creature has the , , or condition. If the creature's legs are bound, the creature has the condition until it escapes. Escaping the Rope requires the creature to make a successful Dexterity () check as an action.

items.name: Sack
items.description: A Sack holds up to 30 pounds within 1 cubic foot.

items.name: Scholar's Pack
items.description: A Scholar's Pack contains the following items: , , , , , 10 flasks of , 10 sheets of , and .

items.description: A creature subjected to Serpent Venom must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 10 () Poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Shovel
items.description: Working for 1 hour, you can use a Shovel to dig a hole that is 5 feet on each side in soil or similar material.

items.name: Signal Whistle
items.description: When blown as a action, a Signal Whistle produces a sound that can be heard up to 600 feet away.

items.name: Sling Bullet
items.description: Sling bullets are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Sling Bullets are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Spyglass
items.description: Objects viewed through a Spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

items.name: Tent
items.description: A Tent sleeps up to two Small or Medium creatures.

items.name: Tinderbox
items.description: A Tinderbox is a small container holding flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a , , , or âor anything else with exposed fuelâtakes a . Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

items.name: Torch
items.description: A Torch burns for 1 hour, casting in a 20-foot radius and for an additional 20 feet. When you take the action, you can attack with the Torch, using it as a Simple Melee weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1 Fire damage.

items.name: Torpor
items.description: A creature subjected to Torpor poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition for hours. The creature's is halved while the creature is in this way.

items.name: Traveler's Clothes
items.description: Traveler's Clothes are resilient garments designed for travel in various environments.

items.name: Truth Serum
items.description: A creature subjected to Truth Serum must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition for 1 hour. The creature can't knowingly communicate a lie.

items.name: Vial
items.description: A Vial holds up to 4 ounces.

items.name: Waterskin
items.description: A Waterskin holds up to 4 pints. If you don't drink sufficient water, you risk dehydration.

items.name: Wyvern Poison
items.description: A creature subjected to Wyvern Poison makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 24 () Poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical. This ammunition is typically found or sold in quantities of ten or twenty pieces. Ten pieces of this ammunition are equivalent in value to a potion of the same rarity )}.

items.description: **Special**:  If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals slashing damage on a hit, instead of .

items.description: The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Firearm Bullets are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.description: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall . The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

items.name: +1 Hoopak
items.description: A hoopak is a sturdy stick with a sling at one end and a pointed tip at the other. **Special**:  When you make a melee attack with this weapon, you ignore its ammunition property. You can use the hoopak as a martial ranged weapon. If you do, it uses the ammunition property, uses sling bullets, and deals bludgeoning damage on a hit.

items.name: +1 Lance
items.description: A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

items.name: +1 Light Repeating Crossbow
items.description: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

items.description: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

items.name: +1 Yklwa
items.description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

items.name: +2 Light Repeating Crossbow
items.description: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

items.name: +2 Needle
items.description: Blowgun needles are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Needles are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: +2 Yklwa
items.description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

items.name: +3 Ammunition
items.description: You have a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical. This ammunition is typically found or sold in quantities of ten or twenty pieces. Ten pieces of this ammunition are equivalent in value to a potion of the same rarity )}.

items.description: **Special**:  If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals slashing damage on a hit, instead of .

items.name: +3 Firearm Bullet
items.description: The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Firearm Bullets are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: +3 Hooked Shortspear
items.description: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall . The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

items.name: +3 Hoopak
items.description: A hoopak is a sturdy stick with a sling at one end and a pointed tip at the other. **Special**:  When you make a melee attack with this weapon, you ignore its ammunition property. You can use the hoopak as a martial ranged weapon. If you do, it uses the ammunition property, uses sling bullets, and deals bludgeoning damage on a hit.

items.name: Adamantine Armor
items.description: This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any against you becomes a normal hit.

items.name: Ammunition of Slaying
items.description: This magic ammunition is meant to slay creatures of a particular type, which the DM chooses or determines randomly by rolling on the table below. If a creature of that type takes damage from the ammunition, the creature makes a Constitution saving throw, taking an extra Force damage on a failed save or half as much extra damage on a successful one. After dealing its extra damage to a creature, the ammunition becomes nonmagical.

items.name: Amulet of Health
items.description: Your Constitution score is 19 while you wear this amulet. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is already 19 or higher without it.

items.name: Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location
items.description: While wearing this amulet, you can't be targeted by Divination spells or perceived through magical scrying sensors unless you allow it.

items.name: Amulet of the Planes
items.description: While wearing this amulet, you can take a action to name a location that you are familiar with on another plane of existence. Then make a Intelligence () check. On a successful check, you cast . On a failed check, you and each creature and object within 15 feet of you travel to a random destination determined by rolling and consulting the following table.

items.name: Animated Shield
items.description: While holding this Shield, you can take a to cause it to animate. The Shield leaps into the air and hovers in your space to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free. The Shield remains animate for 1 minute, until you take a to end this effect, or until you die or have the condition, at which point the Shield falls to the ground or into your hand if you have one free.

items.name: Apparatus of Kwalish
items.description: This item first appears to be a sealed iron barrel weighing 500 pounds. The barrel has a hidden catch, which can be found with a successful Intelligence () check. Releasing the catch unlocks a hatch at one end of the barrel, allowing two Medium or smaller creatures to crawl inside. Ten levers are set in a row at the far end, each in a neutral position, able to move up or down. When certain levers are used, the apparatus transforms to resemble a giant lobster. The Apparatus of Kwalish is a Large object with the following statistics: 20; 200; 30 ft., Swim 30 ft. (or 0 ft. for both if the legs aren't extended); to Poison and Psychic damage. To be used as a vehicle, the apparatus requires one pilot. While the apparatus's hatch is closed, the compartment is airtight and watertight. The compartment holds enough air for 10 hours of breathing, divided by the number of breathing creatures inside. The apparatus floats on water. It can also go underwater to a depth of 900 feet. Below that, the vehicle takes Bludgeoning damage each minute from pressure. A creature in the compartment can take a action to move as many as two of the apparatus's levers up or down. After each use, a lever goes back to its neutral position. Each lever, from left to right, functions as shown in the Apparatus of Kwalish Levers table.

items.name: Armor of Acid Resistance
items.description: You have to Acid damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Cold Resistance
items.description: You have to Cold damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Fire Resistance
items.description: You have to Fire damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Force Resistance
items.description: You have to Force damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Invulnerability
items.description: You have to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage while you wear this armor. **Metal Shell**:  You can take a action to give yourself to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Armor of Lightning Resistance
items.description: You have to Lightning damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Necrotic Resistance
items.description: You have to Necrotic damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Poison Resistance
items.description: You have to Poison damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Psychic Resistance
items.description: You have to Psychic damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Radiant Resistance
items.description: You have to Radiant damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Resistance
items.description: You have to one type of damage while you wear this armor. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly by rolling on the following table.

items.name: Armor of Thunder Resistance
items.description: You have to Thunder damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Armor of Vulnerability (Bludgeoning)
items.description: While wearing this armor, you have to Bludgeoning damage. **Curse**:  This armor is cursed, a fact that is revealed only when the spell is cast on the armor or you attune to it. Attuning to the armor curses you until you are targeted by a spell or similar magic; removing the armor fails to end the curse. While cursed, you have to Piercing and Slashing damage.

items.name: Armor of Vulnerability (Piercing)
items.description: While wearing this armor, you have to Piercing damage. **Curse**:  This armor is cursed, a fact that is revealed only when the spell is cast on the armor or you attune to it. Attuning to the armor curses you until you are targeted by a spell or similar magic; removing the armor fails to end the curse. While cursed, you have to Bludgeoning and Slashing damage.

items.name: Armor of Vulnerability (Slashing)
items.description: While wearing this armor, you have to Slashing damage. **Curse**:  This armor is cursed, a fact that is revealed only when the spell is cast on the armor or you attune to it. Attuning to the armor curses you until you are targeted by a spell or similar magic; removing the armor fails to end the curse. While cursed, you have to Bludgeoning and Piercing damage.

items.name: Arrow of Slaying
items.description: Arrows are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Arrows are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Arrow-Catching Shield
items.description: You gain a +2 bonus to against ranged attack rolls while you wield this Shield. This bonus is in addition to the Shield's normal bonus to AC. Whenever an attacker makes a ranged attack roll against a target within 5 feet of you, you can take a to become the target of the attack instead.

items.name: Bag of Beans
items.description: This heavy cloth bag contains dry beans when found. The bag weighs half a pound regardless of how many beans it contains and becomes a nonmagical item when it no longer contains any beans. If you dump one or more beans out of the bag, they explode in a 10-foot-radius centered on them. All the dumped beans are destroyed in the explosion, and each creature in the , including you, makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. If you remove a bean from the bag, plant it in dirt or sand, and then water it, the bean disappears as it produces an effect 1 minute later from the ground where it was planted. The DM can choose an effect from the following table or determine it randomly.

items.name: Bag of Devouring
items.description: This bag resembles a but is a feeding orifice for a gigantic extradimensional creature. Turning the bag inside out closes the orifice. The extradimensional creature attached to the bag can sense whatever is placed inside the bag. Animal or vegetable matter placed wholly in the bag is devoured and lost forever. When part of a living creature is placed in the bag, as happens when someone reaches inside it, there is a chance that the creature is pulled inside the bag. A creature inside the bag can take an action to try to escape, doing so with a successful Strength () check. Another creature can take an action to reach into the bag to pull a creature out, doing so with a successful Strength () check, provided the puller isn't pulled inside the bag first. Any creature that starts its turn inside the bag is devoured, its body destroyed. Inanimate objects can be stored in the bag, which can hold a cubic foot of such material. However, once each day, the bag swallows any objects inside it and spits them out into another plane of existence. The DM determines the time and plane. If the bag is pierced or torn, it is destroyed, and anything contained within it is transported to a random location on the Astral Plane.

items.name: Bag of Holding
items.description: This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensionsâroughly 2 feet square and 4 feet deep on the inside. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 5 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires a action. If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. The bag holds enough air for 10 minutes of breathing, divided by the number of breathing creatures inside. Placing a Bag of Holding inside an extradimensional space created by a , Portable Hole, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within a 10-foot-radius centered on the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way and can't be reopened.

items.name: Bag of Tricks, Gray
items.description: This bag made from gray cloth appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, fuzzy object. You can take a action to pull the fuzzy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling on the table below. See the for the creature's stat block. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 . The creature is to you and your allies, and it acts immediately after you on your count. You can take a to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, such as attacking an enemy. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature. Once three fuzzy objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Bag of Tricks, Rust
items.description: This bag made from rust cloth appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, fuzzy object. You can take a action to pull the fuzzy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling on the table below. See the for the creature's stat block. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 . The creature is to you and your allies, and it acts immediately after you on your count. You can take a to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, such as attacking an enemy. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature. Once three fuzzy objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Bag of Tricks, Tan
items.description: This bag made from tan cloth appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, fuzzy object. You can take a action to pull the fuzzy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling on the table below. See the for the creature's stat block. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 . The creature is to you and your allies, and it acts immediately after you on your count. You can take a to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, such as attacking an enemy. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature. Once three fuzzy objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Bead of Force
items.description: This small black sphere measures 3/4 of an inch in diameter and weighs an ounce. Typically, Beads of Force are found together. You can take a action to throw the bead up to 60 feet. The bead explodes in a 10-foot-radius on impact and is destroyed. Each creature in the must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take Force damage. A sphere of transparent force then encloses the area for 1 minute. Any creature that failed the save and is completely within the area is trapped inside this sphere. Creatures that succeeded on the save or are partially within the area are pushed away from the center of the sphere until they are no longer inside it. Only breathable air can pass through the sphere's wall. No attack or other effect can pass through. An enclosed creature can take a action to push against the sphere's wall, moving the sphere up to half the creature's . The sphere can be picked up, and its magic causes it to weigh only 1 pound, regardless of the weight of creatures inside.

items.name: Bead of Nourishment
items.description: This flavorless, gelatinous bead dissolves on your tongue and provides as much nourishment as 1 day of Rations.

items.name: Belt of Cloud Giant Strength
items.description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 27. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

items.name: Belt of Dwarvenkind
items.description: While wearing this belt, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Belt of Fire Giant Strength
items.description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 25. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

items.name: Belt of Frost Giant Strength
items.description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 23. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

items.name: Belt of Hill Giant Strength
items.description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 21. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

items.name: Belt of Stone Giant Strength
items.description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 23. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

items.name: Belt of Storm Giant Strength
items.description: While wearing this belt, your Strength score changes to 29. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

items.name: Berserker Axe
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, while you are attuned to this weapon, your maximum increases by 1 for each level you have attained. **Curse**:  This weapon is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the weapon, keeping it within reach at all times. You also have on attack rolls with weapons other than this one. Whenever another creature damages you while the weapon is in your possession, you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or go berserk. This berserk state ends when you start your turn and there are no creatures within 60 feet of you that you can see or hear. While berserk, you regard the creature nearest to you that you can see or hear as your enemy. If there are multiple possible creatures, choose one at random. On each of your turns, you must move as close to the creature as possible and take the action, targeting the creature. If you're unable to get close enough to the creature to attack it with the weapon, your turn ends after you've used up all your available movement. If the creature dies or can no longer be seen or heard by you, the next nearest creature that you can see or hear becomes your new target.

items.name: Black Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Acid damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest black dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Blue Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Lightning damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest blue dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Bolts are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Boots of Elvenkind
items.description: While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have on Dexterity () checks.

items.name: Boots of Levitation
items.description: While you wear these boots, you can cast on yourself.

items.name: Boots of Speed
items.description: While you wear these boots, you can take a to click the boots' heels together. If you do, the boots double your , and any creature that makes an against you has on the attack roll. If you click your heels together again, you end the effect. When you've used the boots' property for a total of 10 minutes, the magic ceases to function for you until you finish a .

items.name: Boots of Striding and Springing
items.description: While you wear these boots, your becomes 30 feet unless your is higher, and your isn't reduced by you carrying weight in excess of your carrying capacity or wearing Heavy Armor. Once on each of your turns, you can jump up to 30 feet by spending only 10 feet of movement.

items.name: Boots of the Winterlands
items.description: These furred boots are snug and feel warm. While wearing them, you gain the following benefits. **Cold Resistance**:  You have to Cold damage and can tolerate temperatures of 0 degrees Fahrenheit or lower without any additional protection. **Winter Strider**:  You ignore created by ice or snow.

items.name: Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals
items.description: While this bowl is filled with water and you are within 5 feet of it, you can take a action to summon a . The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the bowl as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a . The bowl can't be used this way again until the next dawn. The bowl is about 1 foot in diameter and half as deep. It holds about 3 gallons.

items.name: Bracers of Archery
items.description: While wearing these bracers, you have proficiency with the Longbow and Shortbow, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with such weapons.

items.name: Bracers of Defense
items.description: While wearing these bracers, you gain a +2 bonus to if you are wearing no armor and using no Shield.

items.name: Brass Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Fire damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest brass dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Brazier of Commanding Fire Elementals
items.description: While you are within 5 feet of this brazier, you can take a action to summon a . The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the brazier as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a . The brazier can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

items.name: Bronze Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Lightning damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest bronze dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Brooch of Shielding
items.description: While wearing this brooch, you have to Force damage, and you have to damage from the spell.

items.name: Broom of Flying
items.description: This wooden broom functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and take a action to make it hover beneath you, at which time it can be ridden in the air. It has a of 50 feet. It can carry up to 400 pounds, but its becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land or when you're no longer riding it. As a action, you can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you if you name the location and are familiar with it. The broom comes back to you when you take a action and use a command word if the broom is still within 1 mile of you.

items.name: Candle of Invocation
items.description: This candle's magic is activated when the candle is lit, which requires a action. After burning for 4 hours, the candle is destroyed. You can snuff it out early for use at a later time. Deduct the time it burned in increments of 1 minute from its total burn time. While lit, the candle sheds in a 30-foot radius. While you are within that light, you have on . In addition, a Cleric or Druid in the light can cast level 1 spells they have prepared without expending spell slots. Alternatively, when you light the candle for the first time, you can cast with it. Doing so destroys the candle. The portal created by the spell links to a particular Outer Plane chosen by the DM or determined by rolling on the following table.

items.name: Cape of the Mountebank
items.description: This cape smells faintly of brimstone. While wearing it, you can use it to cast as a action. This property can't be used again until the next dawn. When you teleport with that spell, you leave behind a cloud of smoke. The space you left is by that smoke until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Carpet of Flying
items.description: You can make this carpet hover and fly by taking a action and using the carpet's command word. It moves according to your directions if you are within 30 feet of it. Four sizes of Carpet of Flying exist. The DM chooses the size of a given carpet or determines it randomly by rolling on the following table. A carpet can carry up to twice the weight shown on the table, but its is halved if it carries more than its normal capacity.

Ã 5 ft. carpet can carry up to 200 lb. at a fly speed of 80 feet. A carpet can carry up to twice the weight shown on the table, but its is halved if it carries more than its normal capacity.

items.description: You can make this carpet hover and fly by taking a action and using the carpet's command word. It moves according to your directions if you are within 30 feet of it. A 4 ft. Ã 6 ft. carpet can carry up to 400 lb. at a fly speed of 60 feet. A carpet can carry up to twice the weight shown on the table, but its is halved if it carries more than its normal capacity.
