items.description: You can make this carpet hover and fly by taking a action and using the carpet's command word. It moves according to your directions if you are within 30 feet of it. A 5 ft. Ã 7 ft. carpet can carry up to 600 lb. at a fly speed of 40 feet. A carpet can carry up to twice the weight shown on the table, but its is halved if it carries more than its normal capacity.

items.name: Carpet of Flying, 6 ft. Ã 9 ft.
items.description: You can make this carpet hover and fly by taking a action and using the carpet's command word. It moves according to your directions if you are within 30 feet of it. A 6 ft. Ã 9 ft. carpet can carry up to 800 lb. at a fly speed of 30 feet. A carpet can carry up to twice the weight shown on the table, but its is halved if it carries more than its normal capacity.

items.name: Censer of Controlling Air Elementals
items.description: While gently swinging this censer, you can take a action to summon an . The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the censer as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a . The censer can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

items.name: Chime of Opening
items.description: This hollow metal tube measures about 1 foot long and weighs 1 pound. As a action, you can strike the chime to cast . The spell's customary knocking sound is replaced by the clear, ringing tone of the chime, which is audible out to 300 feet. The chime can be used 10 times. After the tenth time, it cracks and becomes useless.

items.name: Circlet of Blasting
items.description: While wearing this circlet, you can cast with it ( to hit). The circlet can't cast this spell again until the next dawn.

items.name: Cloak of Arachnida
items.description: This fine garment is made of black silk interwoven with faint, silvery threads. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits. **Poison Resistance**:  You have to Poison damage. **Spider Climb**:  You have a equal to your and can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. **Spider Walk**:  You can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were . **Web**:  You can cast (save ). The web created by the spell fills twice its normal area. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Cloak of Displacement
items.description: While you wear this cloak, it magically projects an illusion that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual location, causing any creature to have on attack rolls against you. If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while your is 0.

items.name: Cloak of Elvenkind
items.description: While you wear this cloak, Wisdom () checks made to perceive you have , and you have on Dexterity () checks.

items.name: Cloak of Invisibility
items.description: This cloak has 3 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the cloak, you can take a action to pull its hood over your head and expend 1 charge to give yourself the condition for 1 hour. The effect ends early if you pull the hood down (no action required) or cease wearing the hood.

items.name: Cloak of Protection
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

items.name: Cloak of the Bat
items.description: While wearing this cloak, you have on Dexterity () checks. In an area of or , you can grip the edges of the cloak and use it to gain a of 40 feet. If you ever fail to grip the cloak's edges while flying in this way, or if you are no longer in or , you lose this . While wearing the cloak in an area of or , you can cast on yourself, shape-shifting into a . While in that form, you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. The cloak can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

items.name: Cloak of the Manta Ray
items.description: While wearing this cloak, you can breathe underwater, and you have a of 60 feet.

items.name: Copper Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Acid damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest copper dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Crystal Ball
items.description: The typical crystal ball, a very rare item, is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the spell (save ) with it.

items.name: Crystal Ball of Mind Reading
items.description: While touching this crystal orb, you can cast (save ) with it. In addition, you can cast (save ) targeting creatures you can see within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. You don't need to concentrate on this spell to maintain it during its duration, but it ends if the spell ends.

items.name: Crystal Ball of Telepathy
items.description: While touching this crystal orb, you can cast (save ) with it. In addition, you can communicate telepathically with creatures you can see within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. You can also cast (save ) through the sensor on one of those creatures. You don't need to concentrate on this to maintain it during its duration, but it ends if ends. You can't cast in this way again until the next dawn.

items.name: Crystal Ball of True Seeing
items.description: While touching this crystal orb, you can cast (save ) with it. In addition, you have with a range of 120 feet centered on the spell's sensor.

items.name: Cube of Force
items.description: This cube is about an inch across. Each face has a distinct marking on it. You can press one of those faces, expend the number of charges required for it, and thereby cast the spell associated with it (save ), as shown in the Cube of Force Faces table. The cube starts with 10 charges, and it regains expended charges daily at dawn.

items.name: Cubic Gate
items.description: This cube is 3 inches across and radiates palpable magical energy. The six sides of the cube are each keyed to a different plane of existence, one of which is the Material Plane. The other sides are linked to planes determined by the DM. The cube has 3 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. As a action, you can expend 1 of the cube's charges to cast one of the following spells using the cube. **Gate**:  Pressing one side of the cube, you cast , opening a portal to the plane of existence keyed to that side. **Plane Shift**:  Pressing one side of the cube twice, you cast , transporting the targets to the plane of existence keyed to that side.

items.name: Daern's Instant Fortress
items.description: As a action, you can place this 1-inch adamantine statuette on the ground and, using a command word, cause it to grow rapidly into a square adamantine tower. Repeating the command word causes the tower to revert to statuette form, which works only if the tower is empty. Each creature in the area where the tower appears is pushed to an unoccupied space outside but next to the tower. Objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried are also pushed clear of the tower. The tower is 20 feet on a side and 30 feet high, with arrow slits on all sides and a battlement atop it. Its interior is divided into two floors, with a ladder, staircase, or ramp (your choice) connecting them. This ladder, staircase, or ramp ends at a trapdoor leading to the roof. When created, the tower has a single door at ground level on the side facing you. The door opens only at your command, which you can issue as a . It is immune to the spell and similar magic. prevents the tower from being tipped over. The roof, the door, and the walls each have AC 20; HP 100; to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage except that which is dealt by siege equipment; and to all other damage. Shrinking the tower back down to statuette form doesn't repair damage to the tower. Only a spell can repair the tower (this use of the spell counts as replicating a spell of level 8 or lower). Each casting of Wish causes the tower to regain all its .

items.name: Dagger of Venom
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. You can take a to magically coat the blade with poison. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take Poison damage and have the condition for 1 minute. The weapon can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

items.name: Dancing Double-Bladed Scimitar
items.description: **Special**:  If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals slashing damage on a hit, instead of .

items.name: Dancing Sword
items.description: You can take a to toss this magic weapon into the air. When you do so, the weapon begins to hover, flies up to 30 feet, and attacks one creature of your choice within 5 feet of itself. The weapon uses your attack roll and adds your ability modifier to damage rolls. While the weapon hovers, you can take a to cause it to fly up to 30 feet to another spot within 30 feet of you. As part of the same , you can cause the weapon to attack one creature within 5 feet of the weapon. After the hovering weapon attacks for the fourth time, it flies back to you and tries to return to your hand. If you have no hand free, the weapon falls to the ground in your space. If the weapon has no unobstructed path to you, it moves as close to you as it can and then falls to the ground. It also ceases to hover if you grasp it or are more than 30 feet away from it.

items.name: Decanter of Endless Water
items.description: This stoppered flask sloshes when shaken, as if it contains water. The decanter weighs 2 pounds. You can take a action to remove the stopper and issue one of three command words, whereupon an amount of fresh water or salt water (your choice) pours out of the flask. The water stops pouring out at the start of your next turn. Choose from the following command words:

items.name: Deck of Illusions
items.description: This box contains a set of cards. A full deck has 34 cards: 32 depicting specific creatures and two with a mirrored surface. A deck found as treasure is usually missing cards. The magic of the deck functions only if its cards are drawn at random. You can take a action to draw a card at random from the deck and throw it to the ground at a point within 30 feet of yourself. An illusion of a creature, determined by rolling on the Deck of Illusions table, forms over the thrown card and remains until dispelled. The illusory creature created by the card looks and behaves like a real creature of its kind, except that it can do no harm. While you are within 120 feet of the illusory creature and can see it, you can take a action to move it anywhere within 30 feet of its card. Any physical interaction with the illusory creature reveals it to be false, because objects pass through it. A creature that takes a action to visually inspect the illusory creature identifies it as an illusion with a successful Intelligence () check. The illusion lasts until its card is moved or the illusion is dispelled (using a spell or a similar effect). When the illusion ends, the image on its card disappears, and that card can't be used again.

items.name: Deck of Many Things
items.description: Usually found in a box or pouch, this deck contains a number of cards made of ivory or vellum. Most (75 percent) of these decks have thirteen cards, but some have twenty-two. Use the appropriate column of the Deck of Many Things table when randomly determining cards drawn from the deck. Before you draw a card, you must declare how many cards you intend to draw and then draw them randomly. Any cards drawn in excess of this number have no effect. Otherwise, as soon as you draw a card from the deck, its magic takes effect. You must draw each card no more than 1 hour after the previous draw. If you fail to draw the chosen number, the remaining number of cards fly from the deck on their own and take effect all at once. Once a card is drawn, it disappears. Unless the card is the Fool or Jester, the card reappears in the deck, making it possible to draw the same card twice. (Once the Fool or Jester has left the deck, reroll on the table if that card comes up again.) Each card's effect is described below. **Balance**:  You can increase one of your ability scores by 2, to a maximum of 22, provided you also decrease another one of your ability scores by 2. You can't decrease an ability that has a score of 5 or lower. Alternatively, you can choose not to adjust your ability scores, in which case this card has no effect. **Comet**:  The next time you enter combat against one or more creatures, you can select one of them as your foe when you roll . If you reduce your foe to 0 during that combat, you have on Death Saving Throws for 1 year. If someone else reduces your chosen foe to 0 or you don't choose a foe, this card has no effect. **Donjon**:  You disappear and become entombed in a state of suspended animation in an extradimensional sphere. Everything you're wearing and carrying disappears with you except for Artifacts, which stay behind in the space you occupied when you disappeared. You remain imprisoned until you are found and removed from the sphere. You can't be located by any Divination magic, but a spell can reveal the location of your prison. You draw no more cards. **Euryale**:  The card's medusa-like visage curses you. You take a -2 penalty to saving throws while cursed in this way. Only a god or the magic of the Fates card can end this curse. **Fates**:  Reality's fabric unravels and spins anew, allowing you to avoid or erase one event as if it never happened. You can use the card's magic as soon as you draw the card or at any other time before you die. **Flames**:  A powerful devil becomes your enemy. The devil seeks your ruin and torments you, savoring your suffering before attempting to slay you. This enmity lasts until either you or the devil dies. **Fool**:  You have on for the next 72 hours. Draw another card; this draw doesn't count as one of your declared draws. **Gem**:  Twenty-five pieces of jewelry worth 2,000 GP each or fifty gems worth 1,000 GP each appear at your feet. **Jester**:  You have on for the next 72 hours, or you can draw two additional cards beyond your declared draws. **Key**:  A Rare or rarer magic weapon with which you are proficient appears on your person. The DM chooses the weapon. **Knight**:  You gain the service of a , who magically appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 30 feet of yourself. The knight has the same alignment as you and serves you loyally until death, believing the two of you have been drawn together by fate. Work with your DM to create a name and backstory for this NPC. The DM can use a different stat block to represent the knight, as desired. **Moon**:  You gain the ability to cast times. **Puzzle**:  Permanently reduce your Intelligence or Wisdom by (to a minimum score of 1). You can draw one additional card beyond your declared draws. **Rogue**:  An NPC of the DM's choice becomes toward you. You don't know the identity of this NPC until they or someone else reveals it. Nothing less than a spell or divine intervention can end the NPC's hostility toward you. **Ruin**:  All forms of wealth that you carry or own, other than magic items, are lost to you. Portable property vanishes. Businesses, buildings, and land you own are lost in a way that alters reality the least. If you have a Bastion (see the ), it is destroyed by some calamity beyond your control. Any documentation that proves you should own something lost to this card also disappears. **Sage**:  At any time you choose within one year of drawing this card, you can ask a question in meditation and mentally receive a truthful answer to that question. **Skull**:  An appears in an unoccupied space as close to you as possible. The avatar targets only you with its attacks, appearing as a ghostly skeleton clad in a tattered black robe and carrying a spectral scythe. The avatar disappears when it drops to 0 or you die. If an ally of yours deals damage to the avatar, that ally summons another Avatar of Death. The new avatar appears in an unoccupied space as close to that ally as possible and targets only that ally with its attacks. You and your allies can each summon only one avatar as a consequence of this draw. A creature slain by an avatar can't be restored to life. **Star**:  Increase one of your ability scores by 2, to a maximum of 24. **Sun**:  A magic item (chosen by the DM) appears on your person. In addition, you gain 10 daily at dawn until you die. **Talons**:  Every magic item you wear or carry disintegrates. Artifacts in your possession vanish instead. **Throne**:  You gain proficiency and in your choice of , , , or . In addition, you gain rightful ownership of a small keep somewhere in the world. However, the keep is currently home to one or more monsters, which must be cleared out before you can claim the keep as yours. **Void**:  Your soul is drawn from your body and contained in an object in a place of the DM's choice. One or more powerful beings guard the place. While your soul is trapped in this way, your body is inert, ceases aging, and requires no food, air, or water. A spell can't return your soul to your body, but the spell reveals the location of the object that holds your soul. You draw no more cards.

items.name: Defender
items.description: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The first time you attack with the weapon on each of your turns, you can transfer some or all of the weapon's bonus to your . For example, you could reduce the bonus to your attack rolls and damage rolls to +1 and gain a +2 bonus to . The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the weapon to gain a bonus to AC from it.

items.name: Defender Lance
items.description: A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

items.name: Demon Armor
items.description: While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , and you know Abyssal. In addition, the armor's clawed gauntlets allow your Unarmed Strikes to deal Slashing damage instead of the usual Bludgeoning damage, and you gain a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes. **Curse**:  Once you don this cursed armor, you can't doff it unless you are targeted by a spell or similar magic. While wearing the armor, you have on attack rolls against demons and on saving throws against their spells and special abilities.

items.name: Dimensional Shackles
items.description: You can take a action to place these shackles on a creature that has the condition. The shackles adjust to fit a creature of Small to Large size. The shackles prevent a creature bound by them from using any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence. They don't prevent the creature from passing through an interdimensional portal. You and any creature you designate when you use the shackles can take a action to remove them. Once every 30 days, the bound creature can make a Strength () check. On a successful check, the creature breaks free and destroys the shackles.

items.name: Dragon Slayer
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The weapon deals an extra damage of the weapon's type if the target is a Dragon.

items.name: Dragon Slayer Double-Bladed Scimitar
items.description: **Special**:  If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals slashing damage on a hit, instead of .

items.name: Dragon Slayer Hooked Shortspear
items.description: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall . The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

items.name: Dragon Slayer Hoopak
items.description: A hoopak is a sturdy stick with a sling at one end and a pointed tip at the other. **Special**:  When you make a melee attack with this weapon, you ignore its ammunition property. You can use the hoopak as a martial ranged weapon. If you do, it uses the ammunition property, uses sling bullets, and deals bludgeoning damage on a hit.

items.name: Dragon Slayer Lance
items.description: A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

items.name: Dragon Slayer Light Repeating Crossbow
items.description: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

items.name: Dragon Slayer Yklwa
items.description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

items.name: Dust of Disappearance
items.description: This powder resembles fine sand. There is enough of it for one use. When you take a action to throw the dust into the air, you and each creature and object within a 10-foot originating from you have the condition for minutes. The duration is the same for all subjects, and the dust is consumed when its magic takes effect. Immediately after an affected creature makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell, the condition ends for that creature.

items.name: Dust of Dryness
items.description: This small packet contains pinches of dust. As a action, you can sprinkle a pinch of the dust over water, turning up to a 15-foot of water into one marble-sized pellet, which floats or rests near where the dust was sprinkled. The pellet's weight is negligible. A creature can take a action to smash the pellet against a hard surface, causing the pellet to shatter and release the water the dust absorbed. Doing so destroys the pellet and ends its magic. As a action, you can sprinkle a pinch of the dust on an Elemental within 5 feet of yourself that is composed mostly of water (such as a or a ). Such a creature exposed to a pinch of the dust makes a Constitution saving throw, taking Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Dust of Sneezing and Choking
items.description: Found in a small container, this powder resembles , and reveals it to be such. There is enough of it for one use. As a action, you can throw the dust into the air, forcing yourself and every creature in a 30-foot originating from you to make a Constitution saving throw. Constructs, Elementals, Oozes, Plants, and Undead succeed on the save automatically. On a failed save, a creature begins sneezing uncontrollably; it has the condition and is suffocating. The creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The effect also ends on any creature targeted by a spell.

items.name: Dwarven Plate
items.description: While wearing this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to . In addition, if an effect moves you against your will along the ground, you can take a to reduce the distance you are moved by up to 10 feet.

items.name: Dwarven Thrower
items.description: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. It has with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, it deals an extra Force damage, or an extra Force damage if the target is a Giant. Immediately after hitting or missing, the weapon flies back to your hand.

items.name: Efreeti Bottle
items.description: When you take a action to remove the stopper of this painted brass bottle, a cloud of thick smoke flows out of it. At the end of your turn, the smoke disappears with a flash of harmless fire, and an appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. The first time the bottle is opened, the DM rolls on the following table to determine what happens.

items.name: Elemental Gem, Blue Sapphire
items.description: This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you take a action to break the gem, an is summoned, and the gem ceases to be magical. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the broken gem as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a .

items.name: Elemental Gem, Emerald
items.description: This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you take a action to break the gem, a is summoned, and the gem ceases to be magical. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the broken gem as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a .

items.name: Elemental Gem, Red Corundum
items.description: This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you take a action to break the gem, a is summoned, and the gem ceases to be magical. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the broken gem as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a .

items.name: Elemental Gem, Yellow Diamond
items.description: This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you take a action to break the gem, an is summoned, and the gem ceases to be magical. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the broken gem as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a .

items.name: Elixir of Health
items.description: When you drink this potion, you are cured of all magical contagions. In addition, the following conditions end on you: , , , and . The clear, red liquid has tiny bubbles of light in it.

items.name: Elven Chain
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to while you wear this armor. You are considered trained with this armor even if you lack training with Medium or Heavy armor.

items.name: Energy Bow
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which has no string. Each time you pull your arm back in a firing motion, a magical arrow made of golden energy appears nocked and ready to fire. An arrow produced by this weapon deals Force damage instead of Piercing damage on a hit, and it disappears after it hits or misses its target. Until it disappears, the arrow emits in a 20-foot radius and for an additional 20 feet. This weapon has the following additional properties. **Arrow of Restraint**:  Whenever you use this weapon to make a ranged attack against a creature, you can try to restrain the target instead of dealing damage to it. If the arrow hits, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the condition for 1 minute. As an action, a creature by an arrow can make a Strength () check to try to break the restraint, ending the effect on itself on a successful check. **Arrow of Transport**:  As a action, you can fire one energy arrow from this weapon at a target you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The target can be either a willing Medium or smaller creature or an object that isn't being worn or carried, provided the object is small enough to fit inside a 5-foot . The arrow teleports the target to an unoccupied space you can see within 10 feet of you. **Energy Ladder**:  As a action, you can loose a flurry of energy arrows from this weapon at a wall up to 60 feet away from yourself. The arrows become glowing rungs that stick out of the wall, forming a magical ladder up to 60 feet long on the wall. This ladder lasts for 1 minute before disappearing.

items.name: Eversmoking Bottle
items.description: As a action, you can open or close this bottle. Opening the bottle causes thick smoke to billow out, forming a cloud that fills a 60-foot originating from the bottle. The area within the smoke is . Each minute the bottle remains open, the size of the increases by 10 feet until it reaches its maximum size of 120 feet. Closing the bottle causes the cloud to become fixed in place until it disperses after 10 minutes. A strong wind (such as that created by the spell) disperses the cloud after 1 minute.

items.name: Eyes of Charming
items.description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. They have 3 charges. While wearing them, you can expend 1 or more charges to cast (save ). For 1 charge, you cast the level 1 version of the spell. You increase the spell's level by one for each additional charge you expend. The lenses regain all expended charges daily at dawn.

items.name: Eyes of Minute Seeing
items.description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, your vision improves significantly out to a range of 1 foot, granting you within that range and on Intelligence () checks made to examine something within that range.

items.name: Eyes of the Eagle
items.description: These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you have on Wisdom () checks that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

items.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Bronze Griffon
items.description: A is a statuette small enough to fit in a pocket. If you take a action to throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of yourself, the figurine becomes a living creature specified in the figurine's description below. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature. The creature is to you and your allies. It understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions. The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if its creature form drops to 0 or if you take a action while touching the creature to make it revert to figurine form. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified below. **Bronze Griffon (Rare)**:  This bronze statuette is of a griffon rampant. It can become a for up to 6 hours. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 5 days have passed.

items.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Ebony Fly
items.description: A is a statuette small enough to fit in a pocket. If you take a action to throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of yourself, the figurine becomes a living creature specified in the figurine's description below. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature. The creature is to you and your allies. It understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions. The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if its creature form drops to 0 or if you take a action while touching the creature to make it revert to figurine form. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified below. **Ebony Fly (Rare)**:  This ebony statuette, carved in the likeness of a horsefly, can become a for up to 12 hours and can be ridden as a mount. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 2 days have passed.

items.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Golden Lions
items.description: A is a statuette small enough to fit in a pocket. If you take a action to throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of yourself, the figurine becomes a living creature specified in the figurine's description below. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature. The creature is to you and your allies. It understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions. The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if its creature form drops to 0 or if you take a action while touching the creature to make it revert to figurine form. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified below. **Golden Lions (Rare)**:  These gold statuettes of lions are always created in pairs. You can use one figurine or both simultaneously. Each can become a for up to 1 hour. Once a lion has been used, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.

If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature. The creature is to you and your allies. It understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. items.name: Firearm Bullet of Slaying
items.description: The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use. Firearm Bullets are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Flame Tongue
items.description: While holding this magic weapon, you can take a and use a command word to cause flames to engulf the damage-dealing part of the weapon. These flames shed in a 40-foot radius and for an additional 40 feet. While the weapon is ablaze, it deals an extra Fire damage on a hit. The flames last until you take a to issue the command again or until you drop, stow, or sheathe the weapon.

items.name: Flame Tongue Lance
items.description: A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

items.name: Folding Boat
items.description: This object appears as a wooden box that measures 12 inches long, 6 inches wide, and 6 inches deep. It weighs 4 pounds and floats. It can be opened to store items inside. This item also has three command words, each requiring a action to use: When the box becomes a vessel, its weight becomes that of a normal vessel its size, and anything that was stored in the box remains in the boat. Statistics for the and appear in the . If either vessel is reduced to 0 , the Folding Boat is destroyed.

items.name: Frost Brand
items.description: When you hit with an attack roll using this magic weapon, the target takes an extra Cold damage. In addition, while you hold the weapon, you have to Fire damage. In freezing temperatures, the weapon sheds in a 10-foot radius and for an additional 10 feet. When you draw this weapon, you can extinguish all nonmagical flames within 30 feet of yourself. Once used, this property can't be used again for 1 hour.

items.name: Gauntlets of Ogre Power
items.description: Your Strength score is 19 while you wear these gauntlets. They have no effect on you if your Strength is 19 or higher without them.

items.name: Gem of Brightness
items.description: This prism has 50 charges. While you are holding it, you can take a action and use one of three command words to cause one of the following effects: When all of the gem's charges are expended, the gem becomes a nonmagical jewel worth 50 GP.

items.name: Gem of Seeing
items.description: This gem has 3 charges. As a action, you can expend 1 charge. For the next 10 minutes, you have out to 120 feet when you peer through the gem. The gem regains expended charges daily at dawn.

items.name: Giant Slayer
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a Giant with this weapon, the Giant takes an extra damage of the weapon's type and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the condition.

items.name: Giant Slayer Double-Bladed Scimitar
items.description: **Special**:  If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals slashing damage on a hit, instead of .

items.name: Giant Slayer Hooked Shortspear
items.description: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall . The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

items.name: Giant Slayer Hoopak
items.description: A hoopak is a sturdy stick with a sling at one end and a pointed tip at the other. **Special**:  When you make a melee attack with this weapon, you ignore its ammunition property. You can use the hoopak as a martial ranged weapon. If you do, it uses the ammunition property, uses sling bullets, and deals bludgeoning damage on a hit.

items.name: Giant Slayer Lance
items.description: A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

items.name: Giant Slayer Light Repeating Crossbow
items.description: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

items.name: Giant Slayer Yklwa
items.description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

items.name: Glamoured Studded Leather
items.description: While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to . You can also take a to cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks likeâincluding color, style, and accessoriesâbut the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or doff the armor.

items.name: Gloves of Missile Snaring
items.description: If you're hit by an attack roll made with a Ranged or Thrown weapon while wearing these gloves, you can take a to reduce the damage by plus your Dexterity modifier if you have a free hand. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the ammunition or weapon if it is small enough for you to hold in that hand.

items.name: Gloves of Swimming and Climbing
items.description: While wearing these gloves, climbing and swimming don't cost you extra movement, and you gain a +5 bonus to Strength () checks made to climb or swim.

items.name: Gloves of Thievery
items.description: These gloves are imperceptible while worn. While wearing them, you gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity () checks.

items.name: Goggles of Night
items.description: While wearing these dark lenses, you have out to 60 feet. If you already have , wearing the goggles increases its range by 60 feet.

items.name: Gold Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Fire damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest gold dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Green Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Poison damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest green dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

Hammer of Thunderbolts
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The weapon has 5 charges. You can expend 1 charge and make a ranged attack with the weapon, hurling it as if it had with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. If the attack hits, the weapon unleashes a thunderclap audible out to 300 feet. The target and every creature within 30 feet of it other than you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition until the end of your next turn. Immediately after hitting or missing, the weapon flies back to your hand. The weapon regains expended charges daily at dawn. **Giant's Bane**:  While you are attuned to the weapon and wearing either a or to which you are also attuned, you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Hat of Disguise
items.description: While wearing this hat, you can cast the spell. The spell ends if the hat is removed.

items.name: Hat of Many Spells
items.description: This pointed hat has the following properties. **Spellcasting Focus**:  While holding the hat, you can use it as a for your Wizard spells. Any spell you cast using the hat gains a special Somatic component: you must reach into the hat and "pull" the spell out of it. **Unknown Spell**:  While holding the hat, you can try to cast a level 1+ spell you don't know. The spell must be on the Wizard spell list, it must be of a level you can cast, and it can't have Material components costing more than 1,000 GP. Once you decide on the spell, you must expend a spell slot of the spell's level. Then, to determine whether you cast the spell, make an Intelligence () check ( plus the spell's level). On a successful check, you cast the spell using its normal casting time, and you can't use this property again until you finish a or . On a failed check, you fail to cast the spell and a random effect occurs instead, determined by rolling on the following table. Any spell you cast from the hat uses your spell save DC and spell attack bonus.

items.name: Headband of Intellect
items.description: Your Intelligence score is 19 while you wear this headband. It has no effect on you if your Intelligence is 19 or higher without it.

items.name: Helm of Brilliance
items.description: This helm is set with diamonds, rubies, fire opals, and opals. Any gem pried from the helm crumbles to dust. When all the gems are removed or destroyed, the helm loses its magic. You gain the following benefits while wearing the helm. **Diamond Light**:  As long as it has at least one diamond, the helm emits a 30-foot . When at least one Undead is within that area, the is filled with . Any Undead that starts its turn in that area takes Radiant damage. **Fire Opal Flames**:  As long as the helm has at least one fire opal, you can take a action to cause one weapon you are holding to burst into flames. The flames emit in a 10-foot radius and for an additional 10 feet. The flames are harmless to you and the weapon. When you hit with an attack using the blazing weapon, the target takes an extra Fire damage. The flames last until you take a to extinguish them or until you drop or stow the weapon. **Ruby Resistance**:  As long as the helm has at least one ruby, you have to Fire damage. **Spells**:  You can cast one of the following spells (save ), using one of the helm's gems of the specified type as a component: (opal), (fire opal), (diamond), or (ruby). The gem is destroyed when the spell is cast and disappears from the helm. **Taking Fire Damage**:  Roll if you are wearing the helm and take Fire damage as a result of failing a saving throw against a spell. On a roll of 1, the helm emits beams of light from its remaining gems and is then destroyed. Each creature within a 60-foot originating from you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be struck by a beam, taking Radiant damage equal to the number of gems in the helm.

items.name: Helm of Comprehending Languages
items.description: While wearing this helm, you can cast from it.

items.name: Helm of Telepathy
items.description: While wearing this helm, you have telepathy with a range of 30 feet, and you can cast or (save ) from the helm. Once either spell is cast from the helm, that spell can't be cast from it again until the next dawn.

items.name: Helm of Teleportation
items.description: This helm has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can expend 1 charge to cast from it. The helm regains expended charges daily at dawn.

items.name: Heward's Handy Haversack
items.description: This backpack has a central pouch and two side pouches, each of which is an extradimensional space. Each side pouch can hold up to 200 pounds of material, not exceeding a volume of 25 cubic feet. The central pouch can hold up to 500 pounds of material, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The haversack always weighs 5 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the haversack requires a action or a (your choice). When you reach into the haversack for a specific item, the item is always magically on top. If any of its pouches is overloaded, pierced, or torn, the haversack ruptures and is destroyed. If the haversack is destroyed, its contents are lost forever, although an Artifact always turns up again somewhere. If the haversack is turned inside out, its contents spill forth unharmed, and the haversack must be put right before it can be used again. Each pouch of the haversack holds enough air for 10 minutes of breathing, divided by the number of breathing creatures inside. Placing the haversack inside an extradimensional space created by a , , or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate and not behind is sucked through it and deposited in a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

items.name: Holy Avenger
items.description: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a Fiend or an Undead with it, that creature takes an extra Radiant damage. While you hold the drawn weapon, it creates a 10-foot originating from you. You and all creatures to you in the have on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If you have 17 or more levels in the Paladin class, the size of the increases to 30 feet.

items.name: Holy Avenger Double-Bladed Scimitar
items.description: **Special**:  If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals slashing damage on a hit, instead of .

items.name: Holy Avenger Hooked Shortspear
items.description: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall . The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

items.description: A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

items.description: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

items.description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

items.name: Horn of Blasting
items.description: You can take a action to blow the horn, which emits a thunderous blast in a 30-foot that is audible out to 600 feet. Each creature in the makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Thunder damage and has the condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. Glass or crystal objects in the that aren't being worn or carried take Thunder damage. Each use of the horn's magic has a chance of causing the horn to explode. The explosion deals Force damage to the user and destroys the horn.

items.name: Horn of Valhalla
items.description: You can take a action to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you. Each spirit uses the stat block and returns to Ysgard after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 . The spirits look like living, breathing warriors, and they have to the and conditions. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed. Four types of Horn of Valhalla are known to exist, each made of a different metal. The horn's type determines how many spirits it summons, as well as the requirement for its use. The DM chooses the horn's type or determines it randomly by rolling on the following table. If you blow the horn without meeting its requirement, the summoned spirits attack you. If you meet the requirement, they are to you and your allies and follow your commands.

items.name: Horn of Valhalla, Brass
items.description: You can take a action to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you. Each spirit uses the stat block and returns to Ysgard after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 . The spirits look like living, breathing warriors, and they have to the and conditions. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed. A brass horn summons 3 . To use the brass horn, you must have with all Simple weapons. If you blow the horn without meeting its requirement, the summoned attack you. If you meet the requirement, they are to you and your allies and follow your commands.

items.description: You can take a action to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you. Each spirit uses the stat block and returns to Ysgard after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 . The spirits look like living, breathing warriors, and they have to the and conditions. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed. A bronze horn summons 4 . To use the bronze horn, you must have training with all Medium armor. If you blow the horn without meeting its requirement, the summoned attack you. If you meet the requirement, they are to you and your allies and follow your commands.

items.description: You can take a action to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you. If you blow the horn without meeting its requirement, the summoned attack you. If you meet the requirement, they are to you and your allies and follow your commands.

items.name: Horn of Valhalla, Silver
items.description: You can take a action to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you. Each spirit uses the stat block and returns to Ysgard after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 . The spirits look like living, breathing warriors, and they have to the and conditions. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed. A silver horn summons 2 . They are to you and your allies and follow your commands.

items.name: Horseshoes of a Zephyr
items.description: These horseshoes come in a set of four. As a action, you can touch one of the horseshoes to the hoof of a horse or similar creature, whereupon the horseshoe affixes itself to the hoof. Removing a horseshoe also takes a action. While all four shoes are affixed to the hooves of a horse or similar creature, they allow the creature to move normally while floating 4 inches above a surface. This effect means the creature can cross or stand above nonsolid or unstable surfaces, such as water or lava. The creature leaves no tracks and ignores . In addition, the creature can travel for up to 12 hours a day without gaining levels from extended travel.

items.name: Horseshoes of Speed
items.description: These horseshoes come in a set of four. As a action, you can touch one of the horseshoes to the hoof of a horse or similar creature, whereupon the horseshoe affixes itself to the hoof. Removing a horseshoe also takes a action. While all four horseshoes are attached to the same creature, its is increased by 30 feet.

items.name: Immovable Rod
items.description: This iron rod has a button on one end. You can take a action to press the button, which causes the rod to become magically fixed in place. Until you or another creature takes a action to push the button again, the rod doesn't move, even if it defies gravity. The rod can hold up to 8,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes the rod to deactivate and fall. A creature can take a action to make a Strength () check, moving the fixed rod up to 10 feet on a successful check.

items.name: Ioun Stone
items.description: Roughly marble sized, are named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color. When you take a action to toss an into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of feet, conferring its benefit to you while doing so. You can have up to three orbiting your head at the same time. Each orbiting your head is considered to be an object you are wearing. The orbiting stone avoids contact with other creatures and objects, adjusting its orbit to avoid collisions and thwarting all attempts by other creatures to attack or snatch it. As a action, you can seize and stow any number of orbiting your head. If your to an Ioun Stone ends while it's orbiting your head, the stone falls as though you had dropped it. The type of stone determines its rarity and effects.

items.name: Ioun Stone, Absorption
items.description: Roughly marble sized, are named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color. When you take a action to toss an into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of feet, conferring its benefit to you while doing so. You can have up to three orbiting your head at the same time. Each orbiting your head is considered to be an object you are wearing. The orbiting stone avoids contact with other creatures and objects, adjusting its orbit to avoid collisions and thwarting all attempts by other creatures to attack or snatch it. As a action, you can seize and stow any number of orbiting your head. If your to an Ioun Stone ends while it's orbiting your head, the stone falls as though you had dropped it. While this pale lavender ellipsoid orbits your head, you can take a to cancel a spell of level 4 or lower cast by a creature you can see. A canceled spell has no effect, and any resources used to cast it are wasted. Once the stone has canceled 20 levels of spells, it burns out, turns dull gray, and loses its magic.

items.name: Ioun Stone, Agility
items.description: Roughly marble sized, are named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color. When you take a action to toss an into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of feet, conferring its benefit to you while doing so. You can have up to three orbiting your head at the same time. Each orbiting your head is considered to be an object you are wearing. The orbiting stone avoids contact with other creatures and objects, adjusting its orbit to avoid collisions and thwarting all attempts by other creatures to attack or snatch it. As a action, you can seize and stow any number of orbiting your head. If your to an Ioun Stone ends while it's orbiting your head, the stone falls as though you had dropped it. Your Dexterity increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this deep-red sphere orbits your head.

While this dark-blue rhomboid orbits your head, you have on rolls and Wisdom () checks.

A canceled spell has no effect, and any resources used to cast it are wasted. Once the stone has canceled 20 levels of spells, it burns out, turns dull gray, and loses its magic.

Your increases by 1 while this pale green prism orbits your head.

items.description: Roughly marble sized, are named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.
