You gain a +1 bonus to while this dusty-rose prism orbits your head.

items.name: Ioun Stone, Regeneration
items.description: Roughly marble sized, are named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color. When you take a action to toss an into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of feet, conferring its benefit to you while doing so. You can have up to three orbiting your head at the same time. Each orbiting your head is considered to be an object you are wearing. The orbiting stone avoids contact with other creatures and objects, adjusting its orbit to avoid collisions and thwarting all attempts by other creatures to attack or snatch it. As a action, you can seize and stow any number of orbiting your head. If your to an Ioun Stone ends while it's orbiting your head, the stone falls as though you had dropped it. You regain 15 at the end of each hour this pearly white spindle orbits your head if you have at least 1 .

items.name: Ioun Stone, Reserve
items.description: Roughly marble sized, are named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color. When you take a action to toss an into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of feet, conferring its benefit to you while doing so. You can have up to three orbiting your head at the same time. Each orbiting your head is considered to be an object you are wearing. The orbiting stone avoids contact with other creatures and objects, adjusting its orbit to avoid collisions and thwarting all attempts by other creatures to attack or snatch it. As a action, you can seize and stow any number of orbiting your head. If your to an Ioun Stone ends while it's orbiting your head, the stone falls as though you had dropped it. This vibrant purple prism stores spells cast into it, holding them until you use them. The stone can store up to 4 levels of spells at a time. When found, it contains levels of stored spells chosen by the DM. Any creature can cast a spell of level 1 through 4 into the stone by touching it as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the stone. If the stone can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses. While this stone orbits your head, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the stone is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

items.name: Ioun Stone, Strength
items.description: Roughly marble sized, are named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color. When you take a action to toss an into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of feet, conferring its benefit to you while doing so. You can have up to three orbiting your head at the same time. Each orbiting your head is considered to be an object you are wearing. The orbiting stone avoids contact with other creatures and objects, adjusting its orbit to avoid collisions and thwarting all attempts by other creatures to attack or snatch it. As a action, you can seize and stow any number of orbiting your head. If your to an Ioun Stone ends while it's orbiting your head, the stone falls as though you had dropped it. Your Strength increases by 2, to a maximum of 20, while this pale blue rhomboid orbits your head.

items.name: Ioun Stone, Sustenance
items.description: Roughly marble sized, are named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color. When you take a action to toss an into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of feet, conferring its benefit to you while doing so. You can have up to three orbiting your head at the same time. Each orbiting your head is considered to be an object you are wearing. The orbiting stone avoids contact with other creatures and objects, adjusting its orbit to avoid collisions and thwarting all attempts by other creatures to attack or snatch it. As a action, you can seize and stow any number of orbiting your head. If your to an Ioun Stone ends while it's orbiting your head, the stone falls as though you had dropped it. You don't need to eat or drink while this clear spindle orbits your head.

items.name: Iron Bands of Bilarro
items.description: This rusty iron sphere measures 3 inches in diameter and weighs 1 pound. You can take a action to throw the sphere at a Huge or smaller creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. As the sphere moves through the air, it opens into a tangle of metal bands. Make a ranged attack roll with an attack bonus equal to your Dexterity modifier plus your . On a hit, the target has the condition until you take a to issue a command that releases it. Doing so or missing with the attack causes the bands to contract and become a sphere once more. A creature that can touch the bands, including the one , can take an action to make a Strength () check to break the iron bands. On a successful check, the item is destroyed, and the creature is freed. On a failed check, any further attempts made by that creature automatically fail until 24 hours have elapsed. Once the bands are used, they can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Iron Flask
items.description: While holding this brass-stoppered iron flask, you can take a action to target a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. If the flask is empty and the target is native to a plane of existence other than the one you're on, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be trapped in the flask. If the target has been trapped by the flask before, it has on the save. Once trapped, a creature remains in the flask until released. The flask can hold only one creature at a time. A creature trapped in the flask doesn't age and doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink. You can take a action to remove the flask's stopper and release the creature in the flask. The creature then obeys your commands for 1 hour, understanding those commands even if it doesn't know the language in which the commands are given. If you issue no commands or give the creature a command that is likely to result in its death or imprisonment, it defends itself but otherwise takes no actions. At the end of the duration, the creature acts in accordance with its normal disposition and alignment. An spell reveals if the flask contains a creature, but the only way to determine the type of creature is to open the flask. A newly discovered Iron Flask might already contain a creature chosen by the DM or determined randomly by rolling on the following table (see the for the creature's stat block).

items.name: Javelin of Lightning
items.description: Each time you make an attack roll with this magic weapon and hit, you can have it deal Lightning damage instead of Piercing damage. **Lightning Bolt**:  When you throw this weapon at a target no farther than 120 feet from you, you can forgo making a ranged attack roll and instead turn the weapon into a bolt of lightning. This bolt forms a 5-foot-wide between you and the target. The target and each other creature in the (excluding you) makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Immediately after dealing this damage, the weapon reappears in your hand. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Keoghtom's Ointment
items.description: This glass jar, 3 inches in diameter, contains doses of a thick mixture that smells faintly of aloe. The jar and its contents weigh 1/2 pound. As a action, you can swallow one dose of the ointment or apply it to a creature within 5 feet of yourself. The creature that receives it regains and ceases to have the condition.

items.name: Lantern of Revealing
items.description: While lit, this hooded lantern burns for 6 hours on 1 pint of oil, shedding in a 30-foot radius and for an additional 30 feet. creatures and objects are visible as long as they are in the lantern's . You can take a action to lower the hood, reducing the lantern's light to in a 5-foot radius.

items.name: Luck Blade
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While the weapon is on your person, you also gain a +1 bonus to saving throws. **Luck**:  If the weapon is on your person, you can call on its luck (no action required) to reroll one failed if you don't have the condition. You must use the second roll. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn. **Wish**:  The weapon has charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge and cast from it. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn. The weapon loses this property if it has no charges.

items.name: Mace of Disruption
items.description: When you hit a Fiend or an Undead with this magic weapon, that creature takes an extra Radiant damage. If the target has 25 or fewer after taking this damage, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature has the condition until the end of your next turn. **Light**:  While you hold this weapon, it sheds in a 20-foot radius and for an additional 20 feet.

items.name: Mace of Smiting
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The bonus increases to +3 when you use the weapon to attack a Construct. When you roll a 20 on an attack roll made with this weapon, the target takes an extra 7 Bludgeoning damage, or 14 Bludgeoning damage if it's a Construct. If a Construct has 25 or fewer after taking this damage, it is destroyed.

items.name: Mace of Terror
items.description: This magic weapon has 3 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the weapon, you can take a action and expend 1 charge to release a wave of terror from it. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the condition for 1 minute. While in this way, a creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't make . For its action, it can use only the action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If it has nowhere it can move, the creature can take the action. At the end of each of its turns, a creature repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Mantle of Spell Resistance
items.description: You have on saving throws against spells while you wear this cloak.

items.name: Manual of Bodily Health
items.description: This book contains health and diet tips, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, your Constitution increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. The manual then loses its magic, but regains it in a century.

items.name: Manual of Clay Golems
items.description: This tome contains information and incantations necessary to make a . To decipher and use the manual, you must be a spellcaster with at least two 5th-level spell slots. A creature that can't use a and attempts to read it takes psychic damage. To create a clay golem, you must spend 30 days, working without interruption with the manual at hand and resting no more than 8 hours per day. You must also pay 65,000 gp to purchase supplies. Once you finish creating the golem, the book is consumed in eldritch flames. The golem becomes animate when the ashes of the manual are sprinkled on it. It is under your control, and it understands and obeys your spoken commands.

items.name: Manual of Flesh Golems
items.description: This tome contains information and incantations necessary to make a . To decipher and use the manual, you must be a spellcaster with at least two 5th-level spell slots. A creature that can't use a and attempts to read it takes psychic damage. To create a flesh golem, you must spend 60 days, working without interruption with the manual at hand and resting no more than 8 hours per day. You must also pay 50,000 gp to purchase supplies. Once you finish creating the golem, the book is consumed in eldritch flames. The golem becomes animate when the ashes of the manual are sprinkled on it. It is under your control, and it understands and obeys your spoken commands.

items.name: Manual of Gainful Exercise
items.description: This book describes fitness exercises, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, your Strength increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. The manual then loses its magic, but regains it in a century.

items.name: Manual of Golems
items.description: This tome contains information and incantations necessary to make a particular type of golem. To decipher and use the manual, you must be a spellcaster with at least two 5th-level spell slots. A creature that can't use a manual of golems and attempts to read it takes psychic damage. To create a golem, you must spend the time shown on the table, working without interruption with the manual at hand and resting no more than 8 hours per day. You must also pay the specified cost to purchase supplies. Once you finish creating the golem, the book is consumed in eldritch flames. The golem becomes animate when the ashes of the manual are sprinkled on it. It is under your control, and it understands and obeys your spoken commands.

items.name: Manual of Iron Golems
items.description: This tome contains information and incantations necessary to make a . To decipher and use the manual, you must be a spellcaster with at least two 5th-level spell slots. A creature that can't use a and attempts to read it takes psychic damage. To create an iron golem, you must spend 120 days, working without interruption with the manual at hand and resting no more than 8 hours per day. You must also pay 100,000 gp to purchase supplies. Once you finish creating the golem, the book is consumed in eldritch flames. The golem becomes animate when the ashes of the manual are sprinkled on it. It is under your control, and it understands and obeys your spoken commands.

items.name: Manual of Quickness of Action
items.description: This book contains coordination and balance exercises, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, your Dexterity increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. The manual then loses its magic, but regains it in a century.

items.name: Manual of Stone Golems
items.description: This tome contains information and incantations necessary to make a . To decipher and use the manual, you must be a spellcaster with at least two 5th-level spell slots. A creature that can't use a and attempts to read it takes psychic damage. To create a stone golem, you must spend 90 days, working without interruption with the manual at hand and resting no more than 8 hours per day. You must also pay 80,000 gp to purchase supplies. Once you finish creating the golem, the book is consumed in eldritch flames. The golem becomes animate when the ashes of the manual are sprinkled on it. It is under your control, and it understands and obeys your spoken commands.

items.name: Medallion of Thoughts
items.description: The medallion has 5 charges. While wearing it, you can expend 1 charge to cast (save ) from it. The medallion regains expended charges daily at dawn.

items.name: Mirror of Life Trapping
items.description: When this 4-foot-tall, 2-foot-wide mirror is viewed indirectly, its surface shows faint images of creatures. The mirror weighs 50 pounds, and it has AC 11, HP 10, to Poison and Psychic damage, and to Bludgeoning damage. It shatters and is destroyed when reduced to 0 . If the mirror is hanging on a vertical surface and you are within 5 feet of it, you can take a action and use a command word to activate it. It remains activated until you take a action and repeat the command word to deactivate it. Any creature other than you that sees its reflection in the activated mirror while within 30 feet of the mirror must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be trapped, along with anything it is wearing or carrying, in one of the mirror's twelve extradimensional cells. A creature that knows the mirror's nature makes the save with , and Constructs succeed on the save automatically. An extradimensional cell is an infinite expanse filled with thick fog that reduces visibility to 10 feet. Creatures trapped in the mirror's cells don't age, and they don't need to eat, drink, or sleep. A creature trapped within a cell can escape using magic that permits planar travel. Otherwise, the creature is confined to the cell until freed. If the mirror traps a creature but its twelve extradimensional cells are already occupied, the mirror frees one trapped creature at random to accommodate the new prisoner. A freed creature appears in an unoccupied space within sight of the mirror but facing away from it. If the mirror is shattered, all creatures it contains are freed and appear in unoccupied spaces near it. While within 5 feet of the mirror, you can take a action to name one creature trapped in it or call out a particular cell by number. The creature named or contained in the named cell appears as an image on the mirror's surface. You and the creature can then communicate. In a similar way, you can take a action and use a second command word to free one creature trapped in the mirror. The freed creature appears, along with its possessions, in the unoccupied space nearest to the mirror and facing away from it. Placing the mirror inside an extradimensional space created by a , Portable Hole, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate and not behind is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

items.name: Mithral Armor
items.description: Mithral is a light, flexible metal. A mithral chain shirt or breastplate can be worn under normal clothes. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity () checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithral version of the armor doesn't.

items.name: Necklace of Adaptation
items.description: While wearing this necklace, you can breathe normally in any environment, and you have on saving throws made to avoid or end the condition.

items.name: Necklace of Fireballs
items.description: This necklace has beads hanging from it. You can take a action to detach a bead and throw it up to 60 feet away. When it reaches the end of its trajectory, the bead detonates as a level 3 (save ). You can hurl multiple beads, or even the whole necklace, at one time. When you do so, increase the damage of the Fireball by for each bead after the first (maximum ).

items.name: Necklace of Prayer Beads
items.description: This necklace has magic beads made from aquamarine, black pearl, or topaz. It also has many nonmagical beads made from stones such as amber, bloodstone, citrine, coral, jade, pearl, or quartz. If a magic bead is removed from the necklace, that bead loses its magic. Six types of magic beads exist. The DM decides the type of each bead on the necklace or determines it randomly by rolling on the table below. A necklace can have more than one bead of the same type. To use one, you must be wearing the necklace. Each bead contains a spell that you can cast from it as a (using your spell save DC if a save is necessary). Once a magic bead's spell is cast, that bead can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Needle of Slaying
items.description: Blowgun needles are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Needles are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Nine Lives Stealer
items.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. **Life Stealing**:  The weapon has charges. When you attack a creature that has fewer than 100 with this weapon and roll a 20 on the for the attack roll, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be slain instantly as the sword tears its life force from its body. Constructs and Undead succeed on the save automatically. The weapon loses 1 charge if the creature is slain. When the weapon has no charges remaining, it loses this property.

items.name: Nine Lives Stealer Double-Bladed Scimitar
items.description: **Special**:  If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals slashing damage on a hit, instead of .

items.name: Nine Lives Stealer Hooked Shortspear
items.description: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall . The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

items.name: Nine Lives Stealer Hoopak
items.description: A hoopak is a sturdy stick with a sling at one end and a pointed tip at the other. **Special**:  When you make a melee attack with this weapon, you ignore its ammunition property. You can use the hoopak as a martial ranged weapon. If you do, it uses the ammunition property, uses sling bullets, and deals bludgeoning damage on a hit.

items.name: Nine Lives Stealer Lance
items.description: A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

items.name: Nine Lives Stealer Light Repeating Crossbow
items.description: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

items.name: Nine Lives Stealer Yklwa
items.description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

items.name: Nolzur's Marvelous Pigments
items.description: This fine wooden box contains pots of pigment and a brush (weighing 1 pound in total). Using the brush and expending 1 pot of pigment, you can paint any number of three-dimensional objects and terrain features (such as walls, doors, trees, flowers, weapons, webs, and pits), provided these elements are all confined to a 20-foot . The effort takes 10 minutes (regardless of the number of elements you create), during which time you must remain in the , and requires . If your is broken or you leave the before the work is done, all the painted elements vanish, and the pot of pigment is wasted. When the work is done, all the painted objects and terrain features become real. Thus, painting a door on a wall creates an actual door, which can be opened to whatever is beyond. Painting a pit creates a real pit, the entire depth of which must lie within the 20-foot . No object created by a pot of pigment can have a value greater than 25 GP, and the total value of all objects created by a pot of pigment can't exceed 500 GP. If you paint objects of greater value (such as a large pile of gold), they look authentic, but close inspection reveals they're made from paste, cookies, or some other worthless material. If you paint a form of energy such as fire or lightning, the energy dissipates as soon as you complete the painting, doing no harm.

items.name: Oathbow
items.description: When you nock an arrow on this bow, it whispers in Elvish, "Swift defeat to my enemies." When you use this weapon to make a ranged attack, you can utter or sign the following command words: "Swift death to you who have wronged me." The target of your attack becomes your sworn enemy until it dies or until dawn 7 days later. You can have only one such sworn enemy at a time. When your sworn enemy dies, you can choose a new one after the next dawn. When you make a ranged attack roll with this weapon against your sworn enemy, you have on the roll. In addition, your target gains no benefit from or , and you suffer no due to long range. If the attack hits, your sworn enemy takes an extra Piercing damage. While your sworn enemy lives, you have on attack rolls with all other weapons.

items.name: Oil of Etherealness
items.description: One vial of this oil can cover one Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains the effect of the spell for 1 hour. Beads of this cloudy, gray oil form on the outside of its container and quickly evaporate.

items.name: Oil of Sharpness
items.description: One vial of this oil can coat one Melee weapon or twenty pieces of ammunition, but only ammunition and Melee weapons that are nonmagical and deal Slashing or Piercing damage are affected. Applying the oil takes 1 minute, after which the oil magically seeps into whatever it coats, turning the coated weapon into a +3 Weapon or the coated ammunition into +3 Ammunition. This clear, gelatinous oil sparkles with tiny, ultrathin silver shards.

items.name: Oil of Slipperiness
items.description: One vial of this oil can cover one Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature then gains the effect of the spell for 8 hours. Alternatively, the oil can be poured on the ground as a action, where it covers a 10-foot square, duplicating the effect of the spell in that area for 8 hours. This sticky, black unguent is thick and heavy, but it flows quickly when poured.

items.name: Orb of Dragonkind
items.description: Long ago, in the Dragonlance setting, elves and humans waged a terrible war against chromatic dragons. When the world seemed doomed, the wizards of the Towers of High Sorcery came together and forged five Orbs of Dragonkind to help defeat the dragons. One orb was taken to each of the five towers, and there they were used to speed the war toward a victorious end. The wizards used the orbs to lure dragons to them, then destroyed the dragons with powerful magic. As the Towers of High Sorcery fell in later ages, the orbs were destroyed or faded into legend, and only three are thought to survive. Their magic has been warped over the centuries. Their primary purpose of calling dragons still functions, but they also allow some measure of control over dragons. Each orb contains the essence of an evil dragon, a presence that resents any attempt to coax magic from it. Those who try to wield an orb's magic but lack sufficient force of personality might find themselves under the orb's control. An orb is an etched crystal globe about 10 inches in diameter. When used, it grows to about 20 inches in diameter, and mist swirls inside it. While attuned to an orb, you can take a action to peer into the orb's depths. You must then make a Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, you control the orb for as long as you remain attuned to it. On a failed save, the orb imposes the condition on you for as long as you remain attuned to it. While you are by the orb, you can't voluntarily end your to it, and the orb casts on you at will (save ), urging you to work toward the evil ends it desires. The dragon essence within the orb might want many things: the annihilation of a particular society or organization, freedom from the orb, to spread suffering in the world, to advance the worship of , or something else the DM decides. **Random Properties**:  An Orb of Dragonkind has the following random properties: **Spells**:  The orb has 7 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you control the orb, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Call Dragons**:  While you control the orb, you can take a action to cause the orb to issue a telepathic call that extends in all directions for 40 miles. Chromatic dragons in range feel compelled to come to the orb as soon as possible by the most direct route. Dragon deities such as are unaffected by this call. Chromatic dragons drawn to the orb might be toward you for compelling them against their will. Once you have used this property, it can't be used again for 1 hour. **Destroying an Orb**:  An Orb of Dragonkind has AC 20 and is destroyed if it takes damage from a +3 Weapon or a spell. Nothing else can harm it.

items.name: Pearl of Power
items.description: While this pearl is on your person, you can take a action to regain one expended spell slot of level 3 or lower. Once you use the pearl, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Periapt of Health
items.description: While wearing this pendant, you can take a action to regain . Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn. In addition, you have on saving throws to avoid or end the condition while you wear this pendant.

items.name: Periapt of Proof against Poison
items.description: This delicate silver chain has a brilliant-cut black gem pendant. While you wear it, you have to the condition and Poison damage

items.name: Periapt of Wound Closure
items.description: While wearing this pendant, you gain the following benefits. **Life Preservation**:  Whenever you make a , you can change a roll of 9 or lower to a 10, turning a failed save into a successful one. **Natural Healing Boost**:  Whenever you roll a to regain , double the number of it restores.

items.name: Philter of Love
items.description: The next time you see a creature within 10 minutes after drinking this philter, you are by that creature and have the condition for 1 hour. This rose-hued, effervescent liquid contains one easy-to-miss bubble shaped like a heart.

items.name: Pipes of Haunting
items.description: These pipes have 3 charges and regain expended charges daily at dawn. You can take a action to play them and expend 1 charge to create an eerie, spellbinding tune. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the condition for 1 minute. A creature that fails the save repeats it at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on its save is immune to the effect of these pipes for 24 hours.

items.name: Pipes of the Sewers
items.description: While these pipes are on your person, ordinary and are toward you and won't attack you unless you threaten or harm them. The pipes have 3 charges and regain expended charges daily at dawn. If you play the pipes as a action, you can take a to expend 1 to 3 charges, calling forth one with each expended charge if enough rats are within half a mile of you to be called in this fashion (as determined by the DM). If there aren't enough rats to form a swarm, the charge is wasted. Called swarms move toward the music by the shortest available route but aren't under your control otherwise. Whenever a Swarm of Rats that isn't under another creature's control comes within 30 feet of you while you are playing the pipes, the swarm makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the swarm behaves as it normally would and can't be swayed by the pipes' music for the next 24 hours. On a failed save, the swarm is swayed by the pipes' music and becomes to you and your allies for as long as you continue to play the pipes each round as a action. A swarm obeys your commands. If you issue no commands to a swarm, it defends itself but otherwise takes no actions. If a swarm starts its turn more than 30 feet away from you, your control over that swarm ends, and the swarm behaves as it normally would and can't be swayed by the pipes' music for the next 24 hours.

items.name: Plate Armor of Etherealness (*)
items.description: }. While you're wearing this armor, you can take a action and use a command word to gain the effect of the spell. The spell ends immediately if you remove the armor or take a action to repeat the command word. This property of the armor can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Portable Hole
items.description: This fine black cloth, soft as silk, is folded up to the dimensions of a handkerchief. It unfolds into a circular sheet 6 feet in diameter. You can take a action to unfold a Portable Hole and place it on or against a solid surface, whereupon the Portable Hole creates an extradimensional hole 10 feet deep. The cylindrical space within the hole exists on a different plane of existence, so it can't be used to create open passages. Any creature inside an open Portable Hole can exit the hole by climbing out of it. You can take a action to close a Portable Hole by taking hold of the edges of the cloth and folding it up. Folding the cloth closes the hole, and any creatures or objects within remain in the extradimensional space. No matter what's in it, the hole weighs next to nothing. If the hole is folded up, a creature within the hole's extradimensional space can take an action to make a Strength () check. On a successful check, the creature forces its way out and appears within 5 feet of the Portable Hole. A closed Portable Hole holds enough air for 1 hour of breathing, divided by the number of breathing creatures inside. Placing a Portable Hole inside an extradimensional space created by a , , or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate and not behind is sucked through it and deposited in a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.

items.name: Potion of Acid Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Acid damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Animal Friendship
items.description: When you drink this potion, you can cast the level 3 version of the spell (save ). Agitating this potion's muddy liquid brings little bits into view: a fish scale, a hummingbird feather, a cat claw, or a squirrel hair.

items.name: Potion of Clairvoyance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the spell (no required). An eyeball bobs in this potion's yellowish liquid but vanishes when the potion is opened.

items.name: Potion of Climbing
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain a equal to your for 1 hour. During this time, you have on Strength () checks to climb. This potion is separated into brown, silver, and gray layers resembling bands of stone. Shaking the bottle fails to mix the colors.

items.name: Potion of Cloud Giant Strength
items.description: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 27 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score. This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a cloud giant.

items.name: Potion of Cold Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Cold damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Diminution
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the "reduce" effect of the spell for hours (no required). The red in the potion's liquid continuously contracts to a tiny bead and then expands to color the clear liquid around it. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

items.name: Potion of Fire Giant Strength
items.description: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 25 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score. This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a fire giant.

items.name: Potion of Fire Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Fire damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Flying
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain a equal to your for 1 hour and can hover. If you're in the air when the potion wears off, you fall unless you have some other means of staying aloft. This potion's clear liquid floats at the top of its container and has cloudy white impurities drifting in it.

items.name: Potion of Force Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Force damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Frost Giant Strength
items.description: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 23 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score. This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a frost giant.

items.name: Potion of Gaseous Form
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the spell for 1 hour (no required) or until you end the effect as a . This potion's container seems to hold fog that moves and pours like water.

items.name: Potion of Greater Healing
items.description: You regain when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

items.name: Potion of Growth
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the "enlarge" effect of the spell for 10 minutes (no required). The red in the potion's liquid continuously expands from a tiny bead to color the clear liquid around it and then contracts. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

items.name: Potion of Healing
items.description: This potion is a magic item. As a , you can drink it or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of yourself. The creature that drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains . The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

items.name: Potion of Heroism
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain 10 that last for 1 hour. For the same duration, you are under the effect of the spell (no required). This potion's blue liquid bubbles and steams as if boiling.

items.name: Potion of Hill Giant Strength
items.description: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 21 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score. This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a hill giant.

items.name: Potion of Invisibility
items.description: This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid. When you drink the potion, you have the condition for 1 hour. The effect ends early if you make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell.

items.name: Potion of Invulnerability
items.description: For 1 minute after you drink this potion, you have to all damage. This potion's syrupy liquid looks like liquefied iron.

items.name: Potion of Lightning Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Lightning damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Longevity
items.description: When you drink this potion, your physical age is reduced by years, to a minimum of 13 years. Each time you subsequently drink a Potion of Longevity, there is 10 percent cumulative chance that you instead age by years. Suspended in this amber liquid is a tiny heart that, against all reason, is still beating. These ingredients vanish when the potion is opened.

items.name: Potion of Mind Reading
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the spell (save ) for 10 minutes (no required). This potion's dense, purple liquid has an ovoid cloud of pink floating in it.

items.name: Potion of Necrotic Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Necrotic damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Poison
items.description: This concoction looks, smells, and tastes like a or another beneficial potion. However, it is actually poison masked by illusion magic. reveals its true nature. If you drink this potion, you take Poison damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Poison Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Poison damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Psychic Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Psychic damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Radiant Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Radiant damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to one type of damage for 1 hour. The DM chooses the type or determines it randomly by rolling on the following table.

items.name: Potion of Speed
items.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the spell for 1 minute (no required) without suffering the wave of lethargy that typically occurs when the effect ends. This potion's yellow fluid is streaked with black and swirls on its own.

items.name: Potion of Stone Giant Strength
items.description: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 23 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score. This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a stone giant.

items.name: Potion of Storm Giant Strength
items.description: When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes to 29 for 1 hour. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score. This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of fingernail from a storm giant.

items.name: Potion of Superior Healing
items.description: You regain when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

items.name: Potion of Supreme Healing
items.description: You regain when you drink this potion. The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

items.name: Potion of Thunder Resistance
items.description: When you drink this potion, you have to Thunder damage for 1 hour.

items.name: Potion of Vitality
items.description: When you drink this potion, it removes any levels you have and ends the condition on you. For the next 24 hours, you regain the maximum number of for any you spend. This potion's crimson liquid regularly pulses with dull light, calling to mind a heartbeat.

items.name: Potion of Water Breathing
items.description: You can breathe underwater for 24 hours after drinking this potion. This potion's cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

items.name: Quaal's Feather Token
items.description: This object looks like a feather. Different types of feather tokens exist, each with a different single-use effect. The DM chooses the kind of token or determines it randomly by rolling on the Quaal's Feather Tokens table. The type of token determines its rarity.

items.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Anchor
items.description: This object looks like a feather. You can take a action to touch the token to a boat or ship. For the next 24 hours, the vessel can't be moved by any means. Touching the token to the vessel again ends the effect. When the effect ends, the token disappears.

items.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Bird
items.description: This object looks like a feather. You can take a action to toss the token 5 feet into the air. The token disappears and an enormous, multicolored bird takes its place. The bird has the statistics of a , but it can't attack. It obeys your simple commands and can carry up to 500 pounds while flying at its maximum speed (16 miles per hour for a maximum of 144 miles per day, with a 1-hour rest for every 3 hours of flying) or 1,000 pounds at half that speed. The bird disappears after flying its maximum distance for a day or if it drops to 0 . You can dismiss the bird as a action.

items.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Fan
items.description: This object looks like a feather. If you are on a boat or ship, you can take a action to toss the token up to 10 feet in the air. The token disappears, and a giant flapping fan takes its place. The fan floats and creates a strong wind. This wind can fill the sails of one ship, increasing its speed by 5 miles per hour for 8 hours. You can dismiss the fan as a action.

items.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Swan Boat
items.description: This object looks like a feather. You can take a action to touch the token to a body of water at least 60 feet in diameter. The token disappears, and a 50-foot-long, 20-foot-wide boat shaped like a swan takes its place. The boat is self-propelled and moves across water at a speed of 6 miles per hour. You can take a action while on the boat to command it to move or to turn up to 90 degrees. The boat remains for 24 hours and then disappears. You can dismiss the boat as a action.

items.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Tree
items.description: This object looks like a feather. You must be outdoors to use this token. You can take a action to touch it to an unoccupied space on the ground. The token disappears, and in its place a nonmagical oak tree springs into existence. The tree is 60 feet tall and has a 5-foot-diameter trunk, and its branches at the top spread out in a 20-foot radius.

items.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Whip
items.description: This object looks like a feather. You can take a action to throw the token to a point within 10 feet of yourself. The token disappears, and a floating whip takes its place. You can then take a to make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of the whip, with an attack bonus of +9. On a hit, the target takes Force damage. As a , you can direct the whip to fly up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 10 feet of the whip. The whip disappears after 1 hour, when you take a action to dismiss it, or when you die or have the condition.

items.name: Quarterstaff of the Acrobat
items.description: You have a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While holding this weapon, you can cause it to emit green out to 10 feet, either as a or after you roll , or you can extinguish the light as a . While holding this weapon, you can take a to alter its form, turning it into a 6-inch rod (for ease of storage) or a 10-foot pole, or reverting it a Quarterstaff; the weapon will elongate only as far as the surrounding space allows. In certain forms, the weapon has the following additional properties. **Acrobatic Assist (Quarterstaff and 10-Foot Pole Forms Only)**:  While holding this weapon, you have on Dexterity () checks. **Attack Deflection (Quarterstaff Form Only)**:  When you are hit by an attack while holding the weapon, you can take a to twirl the weapon around you, gaining a +5 bonus to your against the triggering attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you. You can't use this property again until you finish a or . **Ranged Weapon (Quarterstaff Form Only)**:  This weapon has with a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 120 feet. Immediately after you make a ranged attack with the weapon, it flies back to your hand.

items.name: Quiver of Ehlonna
items.description: Each of the quiver's three compartments connects to an extradimensional space that allows the quiver to hold numerous items while never weighing more than 2 pounds. The shortest compartment can hold up to 60 , , or similar objects. The midsize compartment holds up to 18 or similar objects. The longest compartment holds up to 6 long objects, such as bows, , or . You can draw any item the quiver contains as if doing so from a regular quiver or scabbard.

items.name: Red Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Fire damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest red dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Ring of Acid Resistance
items.description: You have to Acid damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with pearl.

items.name: Ring of Animal Influence
items.description: This ring has 3 charges, and it regains expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can expend 1 charge to cast one of the following spells (save ) from it:

items.name: Ring of Cold Resistance
items.description: You have to Cold damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with tourmaline.

items.name: Ring of Djinni Summoning
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can take a action to summon a particular from the Elemental Plane of Air. The djinni appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 120 feet of yourself. It remains as long as you maintain , to a maximum of 1 hour, or until it drops to 0 . While summoned, the djinni is to you and your allies, and it obeys your commands. If you fail to command it, the djinni defends itself against attackers but takes no other actions. After the djinni departs, it can't be summoned again for 24 hours, and the ring becomes nonmagical if the djinni dies. Rings of Djinni Summoning are often created by the djinn they summon and given to mortals as gifts of friendship or tokens of esteem.

items.name: Ring of Elemental Command (Air)
items.description: The Ring of Elemental Command (air) is linked to the Elemental Plane of Air. Every Ring of Elemental Command has the following two properties: **Elemental Focus**:  While wearing the ring, you benefit from additional properties corresponding to the ring's linked Elemental Plane: **Spellcasting**:  The ring has 5 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can cast a spell from it. A spell cast from the ring has a save DC of 18. Choose the spell from the following list: (3 charges), (0 charges), (2 charges), (1 charge)

items.name: Ring of Elemental Command (Earth)
items.description: The Ring of Elemental Command (earth) is linked to the Elemental Plane of Earth. Every Ring of Elemental Command has the following two properties: **Elemental Focus**:  While wearing the ring, you benefit from additional properties corresponding to the ring's linked Elemental Plane: **Spellcasting**:  The ring has 5 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can cast a spell from it. A spell cast from the ring has a save DC of 18. Choose the spell from the following list: (5 charges), (2 charges), (3 charges), (3 charges)

items.name: Ring of Elemental Command (Fire)
items.description: The Ring of Elemental Command (fire) is linked to the Elemental Plane of Fire. Every Ring of Elemental Command has the following two properties: **Elemental Focus**:  While wearing the ring, you benefit from additional properties corresponding to the ring's linked Elemental Plane: **Spellcasting**:  The ring has 5 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can cast a spell from it. A spell cast from the ring has a save DC of 18. Choose the spell from the following list: (1 charge), (2 charges), (4 charges), (3 charges)

items.name: Ring of Elemental Command (Water)
items.description: The Ring of Elemental Command (water) is linked to the Elemental Plane of Water. Every Ring of Elemental Command has the following two properties: **Elemental Focus**:  While wearing the ring, you benefit from additional properties corresponding to the ring's linked Elemental Plane: **Spellcasting**:  The ring has 5 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can cast a spell from it. A spell cast from the ring has a save DC of 18. Choose the spell from the following list: (1 charge), (2 charges), (5 charges), (3 charges), (2 charges)

items.name: Ring of Evasion
items.description: This ring has 3 charges, and it regains expended charges daily at dawn. When you fail a Dexterity saving throw while wearing the ring, you can take a to expend 1 charge to succeed on that save instead.

items.name: Ring of Feather Falling
items.description: When you fall while wearing this ring, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling.

items.name: Ring of Fire Resistance
items.description: You have to Fire damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with garnet.

items.name: Ring of Force Resistance
items.description: You have to Force damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with sapphire.

items.name: Ring of Free Action
items.description: While you wear this ring, doesn't cost you extra movement. In addition, magic can neither reduce any of your Speeds nor cause you to have the or condition.

items.name: Ring of Invisibility
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can take a action to give yourself the condition. You remain until the ring is removed or until you take a to become visible again.

items.name: Ring of Jumping
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can cast from it, but can target only yourself when you do so.

items.name: Ring of Lightning Resistance
items.description: You have to Lightning damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with citrine.

items.name: Ring of Mind Shielding
items.description: While wearing this ring, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it. You can take a action to cause the ring to become imperceptible until you take another action to make it perceptible, until you remove the ring, or until you die. If you die while wearing the ring, your soul enters it, unless it already houses a soul. You can remain in the ring or depart for the afterlife. As long as your soul is in the ring, you can telepathically communicate with any creature wearing it. A wearer can't prevent this telepathic communication.

items.name: Ring of Necrotic Resistance
items.description: You have to Necrotic damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with jet.

items.name: Ring of Poison Resistance
items.description: You have to Poison damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with amethyst.

items.name: Ring of Protection
items.description: You gain a +1 bonus to and saving throws while wearing this ring.

items.name: Ring of Psychic Resistance
items.description: You have to Psychic damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with jade.

items.name: Ring of Radiant Resistance
items.description: You have to Radiant damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with topaz.

items.name: Ring of Regeneration
items.description: While wearing this ring, you regain every 10 minutes if you have at least 1 . If you lose a body part, the ring causes the missing part to regrow and return to full functionality after days if you have at least 1 the whole time.

items.name: Ring of Resistance
items.description: You have to one damage type while wearing this ring. The gemstone in the ring indicates the type, which the DM chooses or determines randomly by rolling on the following table.

items.name: Ring of Shooting Stars
items.description: You can cast or from the ring. The ring has 6 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. You can expend its charges to use the properties below. **Faerie Fire**:  You can expend 1 charge to cast from the ring. **Lightning Spheres**:  You can expend 2 charges as a action to create up to four 3-foot-diameter spheres of lightning. Each sphere appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of yourself. The spheres last as long as you maintain , up to 1 minute. Each sphere sheds in a 30-foot radius. As a , you can move each sphere up to 30 feet, but no farther than 120 feet away from yourself. The first time the sphere comes within 5 feet of a creature other than you that isn't behind , the sphere discharges lightning at that creature and disappears. That creature makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes Lightning damage based on the number of spheres you created, as shown in the following table. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. **Shooting Stars**:  You can expend 1 to 3 charges as a action. For every charge you expend, you launch a glowing mote of light from the ring at a point you can see within 60 feet of yourself. Each creature in a 15-foot originating from that point is showered in sparks and makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Ring of Spell Storing
items.description: This ring stores spells cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The ring can store up to 5 levels worth of spells at a time. When found, it contains levels of stored spells chosen by the DM. Any creature can cast a spell of level 1 through 5 into the ring by touching the ring as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect other than to be stored in the ring. If the ring can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses. While wearing this ring, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the ring is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

items.name: Ring of Spell Turning
items.description: While wearing this ring, you have on saving throws against spells. If you succeed on the save for a spell of level 7 or lower, the spell has no effect on you. If that spell targeted only you and didn't create an area of effect, you can take a to deflect the spell back at the spell's caster; the caster must make a saving throw against the spell using their own spell save DC.

items.name: Ring of Swimming
items.description: You have a of 40 feet while wearing this ring.

items.name: Ring of Telekinesis
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can cast from it.

items.name: Ring of the Ram
items.description: This ring has 3 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can take a action to expend 1 to 3 charges to make a ranged spell attack against one creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The ring produces a spectral ram's head and makes its attack roll with a +7 bonus. On a hit, for each charge you spend, the target takes Force damage and is pushed 5 feet away from you. Alternatively, you can expend 1 to 3 of the ring's charges as a action to try to break a nonmagical object you can see within 60 feet of yourself that isn't being worn or carried. The ring makes a Strength check with a +5 bonus for each charge you spend.

items.name: Ring of Three Wishes
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can expend 1 of its 3 charges to cast from it. The ring becomes nonmagical when you use the last charge.

items.name: Ring of Thunder Resistance
items.description: You have to Thunder damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with spinel.

items.name: Ring of Warmth
items.description: If you take Cold damage while wearing this ring, the ring reduces the damage you take by . In addition, while wearing this ring, you and everything you wear and carry are unharmed by temperatures of 0 degrees Fahrenheit or lower.

items.name: Ring of Water Walking
items.description: While wearing this ring, you cast from it, targeting only yourself.

items.name: Ring of X-ray Vision
items.description: While wearing this ring, you can take a action to gain X-ray vision with a range of 30 feet for 1 minute. To you, solid objects within that radius appear transparent and don't prevent light from passing through them. The vision can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, or up to 3 feet of wood or dirt. Thicker substances or a thin sheet of lead block the vision. Whenever you use the ring again before taking a , you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level.

items.name: Robe of Eyes
items.description: This robe is adorned with eyelike patterns. While you wear the robe, you gain the following benefits: **Drawbacks**:  A spell cast on the robe or a spell cast within 5 feet of the robe gives you the condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of your turns, you make a Constitution saving throw ( for Light or for Daylight), ending the condition on yourself on a success.

items.name: Robe of Scintillating Colors
items.description: This robe has 3 charges, and it regains expended charges daily at dawn. While you wear it, you can take a action and expend 1 charge to cause the garment to display a shifting pattern of dazzling hues until the end of your next turn. During this time, the robe sheds in a 30-foot radius and for an additional 30 feet, and creatures that can see you have on attack rolls against you. Any creature in the that can see you when the robe's power is activated must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the condition until the effect ends.

items.name: Robe of Stars
items.description: This black or dark-blue robe is embroidered with small white or silver stars. You gain a +1 bonus to saving throws while you wear it. Six stars, located on the robe's upper-front portion, are particularly large. While wearing this robe, you can take a action to remove one of the stars and expend it to cast the level 5 version of . Daily at dusk, removed stars reappear on the robe. While you wear the robe, you can take a action to enter the Astral Plane along with everything you are wearing and carrying. You remain there until you take a action to return to the plane you were on. You reappear in the last space you occupied or, if that space is occupied, the nearest unoccupied space.

items.name: Robe of the Archmagi
items.description: This elegant garment is made from exquisite cloth and adorned with runes. You gain these benefits while wearing the robe. **Armor**:  If you aren't wearing armor, your base is 15 plus your Dexterity modifier. **Magic Resistance**:  You have on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. **War Mage**:  Your spell save DC and spell attack bonus each increase by 2.

items.name: Robe of Useful Items
items.description: This robe has cloth patches of various shapes and colors covering it. While wearing the robe, you can take a action to detach one of the patches, causing it to become the object or creature it represents. Once the last patch is removed, the robe becomes an ordinary garment. The robe has two of each of the following patches: In addition, the robe has other patches. The DM chooses the patches or determines them randomly by rolling on the following table.

items.name: Rod of Absorption
items.description: While holding this rod, you can take a to absorb a spell that is targeting only you and doesn't create an area of effect. The absorbed spell's effect is canceled, and the spell's energyânot the spell itselfâis stored in the rod. The energy has the same level as the spell when it was cast. A canceled spell dissipates with no effect, and any resources used to cast it are wasted. The rod can absorb and store up to 50 levels of energy over the course of its existence. Once the rod absorbs 50 levels of energy, it can't absorb more. If you are targeted by a spell that the rod can't store, the rod has no effect on that spell. When you become attuned to the rod, you know how many levels of energy the rod has absorbed over the course of its existence and how many levels of spell energy it currently has stored. If you are a spellcaster holding the rod, you can convert energy stored in it into spell slots to cast spells you have prepared or know. You can create spell slots only of a level equal to or lower than your own spell slots, up to a maximum of level 5. You use the stored levels in place of your slots but otherwise cast the spell as normal. For example, you can use 3 levels stored in the rod as a level 3 spell slot. A newly found rod typically has levels of spell energy stored in it. A rod that can no longer absorb spell energy and has no energy remaining becomes nonmagical.

items.name: Rod of Alertness
items.description: This rod has the following properties. **Alertness**:  While holding the rod, you have on Wisdom () checks and on rolls. Spells. While holding the rod, you can cast the following spells from it: **Protective Aura**:  As a action, you can plant the haft end of the rod in the ground, whereupon the rod's head sheds in a 60-foot radius and for an additional 60 feet. While in that , you and your allies gain a +1 bonus to and saving throws and can sense the location of any creature that is also in the . The rod's head stops glowing and the effect ends after 10 minutes or when a creature takes a action to pull the rod from the ground. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rod of Lordly Might
items.description: This rod has a flanged head, and it functions as a magic Mace that grants a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. The rod has properties associated with six different buttons that are set in a row along the haft. It has three other properties as well, detailed below. **Buttons**:  You can press one of the following buttons as a ; a button's effect lasts until you push a different button or until you push the same button again, which causes the rod to revert to its normal form: **Drain Life**:  When you hit a creature with a melee attack using the rod, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes an extra Necrotic damage, and you regain a number of equal to half that Necrotic damage. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn. **Paralyze**:  When you hit a creature with a melee attack using the rod, you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has the condition for 1 minute. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn. **Terrify**:  While holding the rod, you can take a action to force each creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target has the condition for 1 minute. A target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rod of Resurrection
items.description: The rod has 5 charges. While you hold it, you can cast one of the following spells from it: (expends 1 charge) or (expends 5 charges). The rod regains 1 expended charge daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 1, the rod disappears in a harmless burst of radiance.

items.name: Rod of Rulership
items.description: You can take a action to present the rod and command obedience from each creature of your choice that you can see within 120 feet of yourself. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the condition for 8 hours. While in this way, the creature regards you as its trusted leader. If harmed by you or your allies or commanded to do something contrary to its nature, a target ceases to be in this way. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rod of Security
items.description: While holding this rod, you can take a action to activate it. The rod then instantly transports you and up to 199 other willing creatures you can see to a demiplane. You choose the form the demiplane takes. It could be a tranquil garden, a cheery tavern, an immense palace, a tropical island, a fantastic carnival, or whatever else you can imagine. Regardless of its nature, the demiplane contains enough water and food to sustain its visitors, and the demiplane's environment can't harm its occupants. Everything else that can be interacted with there can exist only there. For example, a flower picked from a garden there disappears if it is taken outside the demiplane. For each hour spent in the demiplane, a visitor regains as if it had spent 1 . Also, creatures don't age while there, although time passes normally. Visitors can remain there for up to 200 days divided by the number of creatures present (round down). When the time runs out or you take a action to end the effect, all visitors reappear in the location they occupied when you activated the rod or an unoccupied space nearest that location. Once used, this property can't be used again until 10 days have passed.

items.name: Rope of Climbing
items.description: This 60-foot length of rope can hold up to 3,000 pounds. While holding one end of the rope, you can take a action to command the other end of the rope to animate and move toward a destination you choose, up to the rope's length away from you. That end moves 10 feet on your turn when you first command it and 10 feet at the start of each of your subsequent turns until reaching its destination or until you tell it to stop. You can also tell the rope to fasten itself securely to an object or to unfasten itself, to knot or unknot itself, or to coil itself for carrying. If you tell the rope to knot, large knots appear at 1-foot intervals along the rope. While knotted, the rope shortens to a 50-foot length and grants on ability checks made to climb using the rope. The rope has AC 20, HP 20, and to Poison and Psychic damage. It regains 1 every 5 minutes as long as it has at least 1 . If the rope drops to 0 , it is destroyed.

items.name: Rope of Entanglement
items.description: This rope is 30 feet long. While holding one end of the rope, you can take a action to command the other end to dart forward and entangle one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the condition. You can release the target by letting go of your end of the rope (causing the rope to coil up in the target's space) or by using a to repeat the command (causing the rope to coil up in your hand). A target by the rope can take an action to make its choice of a Strength () or Dexterity () check. On a successful check, the target is no longer by the rope. If you're still holding onto the rope when a target escapes from it, you can take a to command the rope to coil up in your hand; otherwise, the rope coils up in the target's space. The rope has AC 20, HP 20, and to Poison and Psychic damage. It regains 1 every 5 minutes as long as it has at least 1 . If the rope drops to 0 , it is destroyed.

items.name: Scarab of Protection
items.description: This beetle-shaped medallion provides three benefits while it is on your person. **Defense**:  You gain a +1 bonus to . **Preservation**:  The scarab has 12 charges. If you fail a saving throw against a Necromancy spell or a harmful effect originating from an Undead, you can take a to expend 1 charge and turn the failed save into a successful one. The scarab crumbles into powder and is destroyed when its last charge is expended. **Spell Resistance**:  You have on saving throws against spells.

items.name: Scimitar of Speed
items.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, you can make one attack with it as a on each of your turns.

items.name: Sending Stones
items.description: Sending Stones come in pairs, with each stone carved to match the other so the pairing is easily recognized. While you touch one stone, you can cast from it. The target is the bearer of the other stone. If no creature bears the other stone, you know that fact as soon as you use the stone, and you don't cast the spell. Once Sending is cast using either stone, the stones can't be used again until the next dawn. If one of the stones in a pair is destroyed, the other one becomes nonmagical.

items.name: Sentinel Shield
items.description: While holding this Shield, you have on rolls and Wisdom () checks. The Shield is emblazoned with a symbol of an eye.

items.name: Shield of Missile Attraction
items.description: While holding this Shield, you have to damage from attacks made with Ranged weapons. **Curse**:  This Shield is cursed. Attuning to it curses you until you are targeted by a spell or similar magic. Removing the Shield fails to end the curse on you. Whenever an attack with a Ranged weapon targets a creature within 10 feet of you, the curse causes you to become the target instead.

items.name: Shield of the Cavalier
items.description: While holding this Shield, you have a +2 bonus to . This bonus is in addition to the Shield's normal bonus to AC. The Shield has the following additional properties that you can use while holding it. **Forceful Bash**:  When you take the , you can make one of the attack rolls using the Shield against a target within 5 feet of yourself. Apply your and Strength modifier to the attack roll. On a hit, the Shield deals Force damage to the target equal to plus your Strength modifier, and if the target is a creature, you can push it up to 10 feet directly away from yourself. If the creature is your size or smaller, you can also knock it down, giving it the condition. **Protective Field**:  As a , when you or an ally you can see within 5 feet of you is targeted by an attack or makes a saving throw against an area of effect, you can use the Shield to create an immobile 5-foot originating from you. When the appears, any creatures or objects not fully contained within it are pushed into the nearest unoccupied spaces outside it. The attack or area of effect that triggered the has no effect on creatures and objects inside the , which lasts as long as you maintain , up to 1 minute. Nothing can pass into or out of the . A creature or object inside the can't be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, nor can a creature inside the damage anything outside it. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Silver Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Cold damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest silver dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Sling Bullet of Slaying
items.description: Sling bullets are used with a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack (you need a free hand to load a one-handed weapon). At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield. Sling Bullets are typically stored in a (bought separately).

items.name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
items.description: While you wear these light shoes, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a equal to your . However, the slippers don't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.

items.name: Sovereign Glue
items.description: This viscous, milky-white substance can form a permanent adhesive bond between any two objects. It must be stored in a jar or flask that has been coated inside with . When found, a container contains ounces. One ounce of the glue can cover a 1-foot square surface. Applying an ounce of Sovereign Glue takes a action, and the applied glue takes 1 minute to set. Once it has done so, the bond it creates can be broken only by the application of or , or with a spell.

items.name: Spell Scroll (Cantrip)
items.description: A Spell Scroll bears the words of a single spell, written in a mystical cipher. If the spell is on your spell list, you can read the scroll and cast its spell without Material components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the scroll crumbles to dust. If the casting is interrupted, the scroll isn't lost. If the spell is on your spell list but of a higher level than you can normally cast, you make a ability check using your spellcasting ability to determine whether you cast the spell. On a failed check, the spell disappears from the scroll with no other effect. If the spell requires a saving throw or an attack roll, the spell save DC is 13, and the attack bonus is .

items.name: Spell Scroll (Level 1)
items.description: A Spell Scroll bears the words of a single spell, written in a mystical cipher. If the spell is on your spell list, you can read the scroll and cast its spell without Material components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the scroll crumbles to dust. If the casting is interrupted, the scroll isn't lost. If the spell is on your spell list but of a higher level than you can normally cast, you make a ability check using your spellcasting ability to determine whether you cast the spell. On a failed check, the spell disappears from the scroll with no other effect. If the spell requires a saving throw or an attack roll, the spell save DC is 13, and the attack bonus is . **Copying a Scroll into a Spellbook**:  A Wizard spell on a Spell Scroll can be copied into a spellbook. When a level 1 spell is copied in this way, the copier must succeed on a Intelligence (). On a successful check, the spell is copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the Spell Scroll is destroyed.
