When a level 9 spell is copied in this way, the copier must succeed on a Intelligence (). On a successful check, the spell is copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the Spell Scroll is destroyed.

items.name: Spellguard Shield
items.description: While holding this Shield, you have on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attack rolls have against you.

items.name: Sphere of Annihilation
items.description: This 2-foot-diameter black sphere is a hole in the multiverse, hovering in space and stabilized by a magical field surrounding it. The sphere obliterates all matter it passes through and all matter that passes through it. Artifacts are the exception. Unless an Artifact is susceptible to damage from a Sphere of Annihilation, it passes through the sphere unscathed. Anything else that touches the sphere but isn't wholly engulfed and obliterated by it takes Force damage. **Controlling the Sphere**:  A Sphere of Annihilation is stationary until someone takes control of it. If you are within 60 feet of a sphere, you can take a action to make a Intelligence () check. On a successful check, you control the sphere until the start of your next turn, and if it was under another creature's control, that creature loses control of the sphere. On a failed check, the sphere moves 10 feet toward you in a straight line. While in control of the sphere, you can take a to cause it to move in one direction of your choice, up to a number of feet equal to 5 times your Intelligence modifier (minimum 5 feet). Any creature whose space the sphere enters must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be touched by it, taking Force damage. A creature reduced to 0 by this damage is obliterated, leaving its possessions behind but no other physical remains. **Sphere Interactions**:  If the sphere comes into contact with a planar portal (such as that created by the spell) or an extradimensional space (such as that within a Portable Hole), the DM determines randomly what happens using the following table.

items.name: Staff of Charming
items.description: This staff has 10 charges. While holding the staff, you can use any of its properties: **Regaining Charges**:  The staff regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 1, the staff crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

items.name: Staff of Fire
items.description: You have to Fire damage while you hold this staff. **Spells**:  The staff has 10 charges. While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Regaining Charges**:  The staff regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 1, the staff crumbles into cinders and is destroyed.

items.name: Staff of Frost
items.description: You have to Cold damage while you hold this staff. **Spells**:  The staff has 10 charges. While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Regaining Charges**:  The staff regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 1, the staff turns to water and is destroyed.

items.name: Staff of Healing
items.description: This staff has 10 charges. While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spellcasting ability modifier. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Regaining Charges**:  The staff regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 1, the staff vanishes in a flash of light, lost forever.

items.name: Staff of Power
items.description: This staff has 20 charges and can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +2 bonus to , saving throws, and spell attack rolls. **Spells**:  While holding the staff , you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Regaining Charges**:  The staff regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 1, the staff retains its +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls but loses all other properties. On a 20, the staff regains charges. **Retributive Strike**:  You can take a action to break the staff over your knee or against a solid surface. The staff is destroyed and releases its magic in an explosion that fills a 30-foot originating from itself. You have a chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion. If you fail to avoid the effect, you take Force damage equal to 16 times the number of charges in the staff . Each other creature in the area makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Force damage equal to 4 times the number of charges in the staff . On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

items.name: Staff of Striking
items.description: This staff can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff that grants a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. The staff has 10 charges. When you hit with a melee attack using it, you can expend up to 3 charges. For each charge you expend, the target takes an extra Force damage. **Regaining Charges**:  The staff regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 1, the staff becomes a nonmagical Quarterstaff.

items.name: Staff of Swarming Insects
items.description: This staff has 10 charges. **Insect Cloud**:  While holding the staff , you can take a action and expend 1 charge to cause a swarm of harmless flying insects to fill a 30-foot originating from you. The insects remain for 10 minutes, making the area for creatures other than you. A strong wind (like that created by ) disperses the swarm and ends the effect. **Spells**:  While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack modifier. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Regaining Charges**:  The staff regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 1, a swarm of insects consumes and destroys the staff, then disperses.

items.name: Staff of the Magi
items.description: This staff has 50 charges and can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. While you hold it, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. **Spell Absorption**:  While holding the staff , you have on saving throws against spells. In addition, you can take a when another creature casts a spell that targets only you. If you do, the staff absorbs the magic of the spell, canceling its effect and gaining a number of charges equal to the absorbed spell's level. However, if doing so brings the staff's total number of charges above 50, the staff explodes as if you activated its Retributive Strike (see below). **Spells**:  While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Regaining Charges**:  The staff regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 20, the staff regains charges. **Retributive Strike**:  You can take a action to break the staff over your knee or against a solid surface. The staff is destroyed and releases its magic in an explosion that fills a 30-foot originating from itself. You have a chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion. If you fail to avoid the effect, you take Force damage equal to 16 times the number of charges in the staff. Each other creature in the area makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Force damage equal to 6 times the number of charges in the staff. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

items.name: Staff of the Python
items.description: As a action, you can throw this staff so that it lands in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you, causing the staff to become a in that space. The snake is under your control and shares your count, taking its turn immediately after yours. On your turn, you can mentally command the snake (no action required) if it is within 60 feet of you and you don't have the condition. You decide what action the snake takes and where it moves during its turn, or you can issue it a general command, such as to attack your enemies or guard a location. Absent commands from you, the snake defends itself. As a , you can command the snake to revert to staff form in its current space, and you can't use the staff's property again for 1 hour. If the snake is reduced to 0 , it dies and reverts to its staff form; the staff then shatters and is destroyed. If the snake reverts to staff form before losing all its , it regains all of them.

items.name: Staff of the Woodlands
items.description: This staff has 6 charges and can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you have a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. **Spells**:  While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Tree Form**:  You can take a action to plant one end of the staff in earth in an unoccupied space and expend 1 charge to transform the staff into a healthy tree. The tree is 60 feet tall and has a 5-foot-diameter trunk, and its branches at the top spread out in a 20-foot radius. The tree appears ordinary but radiates a faint aura of Transmutation magic that can be discerned with the spell. While touching the tree and using a action, you return the staff to its normal form. Any creature in the tree falls when the tree reverts to a staff. **Regaining Charges**:  The staff regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll . On a 1, the staff loses its properties and becomes a nonmagical Quarterstaff.

items.name: Staff of Thunder and Lightning
items.description: This staff can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. It also has the following additional properties. Once one of these properties is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn. **Lightning**:  When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can cause the target to take an extra Lightning damage (no action required). **Thunder**:  When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can cause the staff to emit a crack of thunder audible out to 300 feet (no action required). The target you hit must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition until the end of your next turn. **Thunder and Lightning**:  Immediately after you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can take a to use the Lightning and Thunder properties (see above) at the same time. Doing so doesn't expend the daily use of those properties, only the use of this one. **Lightning Strike**:  You can take a action to cause a bolt of lightning to leap from the staff's tip in a that is 5 feet wide and 120 feet long. Each creature in that makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. **Thunderclap**:  You can take a action to cause the staff to produce a thunderclap audible out to 600 feet. Every creature within a 60-foot originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Thunder damage and has the condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

items.name: Staff of Withering
items.description: This staff has 3 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. The staff can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff. On a hit, it deals damage as a normal Quarterstaff , and you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra Necrotic damage to the target and force it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has for 1 hour on any ability check or saving throw that uses Strength or Constitution.

items.name: Stone of Controlling Earth Elementals
items.description: While touching this 5-pound stone to the ground, you can take a action to summon an . The elemental appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 30 feet of yourself, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a . The stone can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

items.name: Stone of Good Luck
items.description: While this polished agate is on your person, you gain a +1 bonus to ability checks and saving throws.

items.name: Studded Leather Armor of Acid Resistance
Studded Leather Armor of Cold Resistance
Studded Leather Armor of Fire Resistance
Studded Leather Armor of Force Resistance
Studded Leather Armor of Lightning Resistance
Studded Leather Armor of Necrotic Resistance
Studded Leather Armor of Poison Resistance
Studded Leather Armor of Psychic Resistance
Studded Leather Armor of Radiant Resistance
Studded Leather Armor of Thunder Resistance
Sun Blade
items.description: This item appears to be a sword hilt. **Blade of Radiance**:  While grasping the hilt, you can take a to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic weapon functions as a Longsword with . If you are proficient with Longswords or Shortswords, you are proficient with the Sun Blade. You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals Radiant damage instead of Slashing damage. When you hit an Undead with it, that target takes an extra Radiant damage. **Sunlight**:  The sword's luminous blade emits in a 15-foot radius and for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. While the blade persists, you can take a action to expand or reduce its radius of and by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.

items.name: Sword of Life Stealing
items.description: When you attack a creature with this magic weapon and roll a 20 on the for the attack roll, that target takes an extra 15 Necrotic damage if it isn't a Construct or an Undead, and you gain equal to the amount of Necrotic damage taken.

items.name: Sword of Sharpness
items.description: When you attack an object with this magic weapon and hit, maximize your weapon damage dice against the target. When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the for the attack roll, that target takes an extra 14 Slashing damage and gains 1 level.

items.name: Sword of Wounding
items.description: When you hit a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target takes an extra Necrotic damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be unable to regain for 1 hour. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Talisman of Pure Good
items.description: This talisman is a mighty symbol of goodness. A Fiend or an Undead that touches the talisman takes Radiant damage and takes the damage again each time it ends its turn holding or carrying the talisman. **Holy Symbol**:  You can use the talisman as a Holy Symbol. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls while you wear or hold it. **Pure Rebuke**:  The talisman has 7 charges. While wearing or holding the talisman, you can take a action to expend 1 charge and target one creature you can see on the ground within 120 feet of yourself. A flaming fissure opens under the target, and the target makes a Dexterity saving throw. If the target is a Fiend or an Undead, it has on the save. On a failed save, the target falls into the fissure and is destroyed, leaving no remains. On a successful save, the target isn't cast into the fissure but takes Psychic damage from the ordeal. In either case, the fissure then closes, leaving no trace of its existence. When you expend the last charge, the talisman disperses into motes of golden light and is destroyed.

items.name: Talisman of the Sphere
items.description: While holding or wearing this talisman, you have on any Intelligence () check you make to control a . In addition, when you start your turn in control of a , you can take a action to move it 10 feet plus a number of additional feet equal to 10 times your Intelligence modifier. This movement doesn't have to be in a straight line.

items.name: Talisman of Ultimate Evil
items.description: This item symbolizes unrepentant evil. A creature that isn't a Fiend or an Undead that touches the talisman takes Necrotic damage and takes the damage again each time it ends its turn holding or carrying the talisman. **Holy Symbol**:  You can use the talisman as a Holy Symbol. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls while you wear or hold it. **Ultimate End**:  The talisman has 6 charges. While wearing or holding the talisman, you can take a action to expend 1 charge and target one creature you can see on the ground within 120 feet of yourself. A flaming fissure opens under the target, and the target makes a Dexterity saving throw. If the target is a Celestial, it has on the save. On a failed save, the target falls into the fissure and is destroyed, leaving no remains. On a successful save, the target isn't cast into the fissure but takes Psychic damage from the ordeal. In either case, the fissure then closes, leaving no trace of its existence. When you expend the last charge, the talisman dissolves into foul-smelling slime and is destroyed.

items.name: Thunderous Greatclub
items.description: While you are attuned to this magic weapon, your Strength is 20 unless your Strength is already equal to or greater than that score. The weapon deals an extra Thunder damage to any creature it hits and an extra Thunder damage to objects it hits that aren't being worn or carried. The weapon has the following additional properties. **Clap of Thunder**:  As a action, you can strike the weapon against a hard surface to create a loud clap of thunder audible out to 300 feet. You also create a 30-foot of thunderous energy. Each creature in the must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the condition. Nonmagical objects in the that aren't being worn or carried take Thunder damage. **Earthquake**:  As a action, you can strike the weapon against the ground to create an intense seismic disturbance in a 50-foot-radius circle centered on the point of impact. Structures in contact with the ground in that area take 50 Bludgeoning damage, and each creature on the ground in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the condition. If that creature is also , it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or its is broken. In addition, you can cause a 30-foot-deep, 10-foot-wide fissure to open up on the ground anywhere in the area. Any creature on a spot where the fissure opens must make a Dexterity saving throw, falling into the fissure on a failed save or moving with the fissure's edge on a successful one. Any structure on a spot where the fissure opens collapses into the fissure. Once you use this property, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Tome of Clear Thought
items.description: This book contains memory and logic exercises, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, your Intelligence increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. The manual then loses its magic, but regains it in a century.

items.name: Tome of Leadership and Influence
items.description: This book contains guidelines for influencing and charming others, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, your Charisma increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. The manual then loses its magic, but regains it in a century.

items.name: Tome of Understanding
items.description: This book contains intuition and insight exercises, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, your Wisdom increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. The manual then loses its magic, but regains it in a century.

items.name: Trident of Fish Command
items.description: This magic weapon has 3 charges, and it regains expended charges daily at dawn. While you carry it, you can expend 1 charge to cast (save ) from it on a Beast that has a .

items.name: Universal Solvent
items.description: This tube holds milky liquid with a strong alcohol smell. When found, a tube contains ounces. You can take a action to pour 1 or more ounces of solvent from the tube onto a surface within reach. Each ounce instantly dissolves up to 1 square foot of adhesive it touches, including Sovereign Glue.

items.name: Vicious Double-Bladed Scimitar
items.description: **Special**:  If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals slashing damage on a hit, instead of .

items.name: Vicious Hooked Shortspear
items.description: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall . The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

items.name: Vicious Hoopak
items.description: A hoopak is a sturdy stick with a sling at one end and a pointed tip at the other. **Special**:  When you make a melee attack with this weapon, you ignore its ammunition property. You can use the hoopak as a martial ranged weapon. If you do, it uses the ammunition property, uses sling bullets, and deals bludgeoning damage on a hit.

items.name: Vicious Lance
items.description: A Lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

items.name: Vicious Light Repeating Crossbow
items.description: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

items.name: Vicious Weapon
items.description: This magic weapon deals an extra damage to any creature it hits. This extra damage is of the same type as the weapon's normal damage.

items.name: Vicious Yklwa
items.description: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

items.name: Vorpal Sword
items.description: You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the weapon ignores to Slashing damage. When you use this weapon to attack a creature that has at least one head and roll a 20 on the for the attack roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it has to Slashing damage, if it doesn't have or need a head, or if the DM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra 30 Slashing damage from the hit. If the creature has Legendary , it can expend one daily use of that trait to avoid losing its head, taking the extra damage instead.

items.name: Wand of Binding
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. **Spells**:  While holding the wand, you can cast one of the spells (save ) on the following table from it. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

items.name: Wand of Enemy Detection
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can take a action to expend 1 charge. For 1 minute, you know the direction of the nearest creature to you within 60 feet, but not its distance from you. The wand can sense the presence of creatures that are , ethereal, disguised, or hidden, as well as those in plain sight. The effect ends if you stop holding the wand. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

items.name: Wand of Fear
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. **Spells**:  While holding the wand, you can cast one of the spells (save ) on the following table from it. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

items.name: Wand of Fireballs
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend no more than 3 charges to cast (save ) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the level 3 version of the spell. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

items.name: Wand of Lightning Bolts
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend no more than 3 charges to cast (save ) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the level 3 version of the spell. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

items.name: Wand of Magic Detection
items.description: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge to cast from it. The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn.

items.name: Wand of Magic Missiles
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend no more than 3 charges to cast from it. For 1 charge, you cast the level 1 version of the spell. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

items.name: Wand of Paralysis
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can take a action to expend 1 charge to cause a thin blue ray to streak from the tip toward a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

items.name: Wand of Polymorph
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge to cast (save ) from it. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

items.name: Wand of Secrets
items.description: This wand has 3 charges and regains expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can take a action to expend 1 charge, and if a secret door or trap is within 60 feet of you, the wand pulses and points at the one nearest to you.

items.name: Wand of Web
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge to cast (save ) from it. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

items.name: Wand of Wonder
items.description: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can take a action to expend 1 charge while choosing a point within 120 feet of yourself. That location becomes the point of origin of a spell or other magical effect determined by rolling on the Wand of Wonder Effects table. Spells cast from the wand have a save DC of 15. If a spell's maximum range is normally less than 120 feet, it becomes 120 feet when cast from the wand. If an effect has multiple possible subjects, the DM determines randomly which among them are affected. **Regaining Charges**:  The wand regains expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll . On a 1, the wand crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

items.name: Well of Many Worlds
items.description: This fine black cloth, soft as silk, is folded up to the dimensions of a handkerchief. It unfolds into a circular sheet 6 feet in diameter. You can take a action to unfold the Well of Many Worlds and place it on a solid surface, whereupon it forms a two-way, 6-foot-diameter, circular portal to another world or plane of existence. Each time the item opens a portal, the DM decides where it leads. The portal remains open until a creature within 5 feet of it takes a action to close it by taking hold of the edges of the cloth and folding it up. Once the Well of Many Worlds has opened a portal, it can't do so again for hours.

items.name: White Dragon Scale Mail
items.description: Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued. While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to , you have on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have to Cold damage. Additionally, you can focus your senses as a action to discern the distance and direction to the closest white dragon within 30 miles of yourself. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Wind Fan
items.description: While holding this fan, you can cast (save ) from it. Each subsequent time the fan is used before the next dawn, it has a cumulative chance of not working; if the fan fails to work, it tears into useless, nonmagical tatters.

items.name: Winged Boots
items.description: These boots have 4 charges and regain expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the boots, you can take a action to expend 1 charge, gaining a of 30 feet for 1 hour. If you are flying when the duration expires, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land.

items.name: Wings of Flying
items.description: While wearing this cloak, you can take a action to turn the cloak into a pair of wings on your back. The wings lasts for 1 hour or until you end the effect early as a action. The wings give you a of 60 feet. If you are aloft when the wings disappear, you fall. When the wings disappear, you can't use them again for hours.
